text: I have now gone on charters with Captain Black for the past 4 years. He's very personable and knowledgeable and works hard to make sure that everybody has a great time. From communicating about weather conditions ahead of the trip, to cleaning the catch at the end of the trip, Captain Black provides a great experience for all.

resp.text: Thank you Tim. Always enjoy your company and guest!

name: Josh Parmer
text: Our family highly recommends Reel Attraction charters!!!! The captain was patient, fun, and personable. All 6 of us, both kids and adults had a blast! Captain didn't want to waist our time in spots that weren't hitting, and kept us all smiling the entire time!!! Would most definitely choose Reel Attractions again!

resp.text: Josh thank you for the review. I really enjoyed your group and hope to see you in the future. You guys stay safe!

name: Dylan Walters
text: Me and my 3 sons had a great time on our fishing charter with Captain Black. It was all business from start to finish. Limited on Red Snapper in about 30 minutes of fishing. We will be fishing with Real Attraction Charters again in 2018 !

resp.text: Thank you guys for fishing with us and really had a great time with your crew!

name: Vicky Bowerman
text: Very prepared and organized.  Had a great plan for catching fish. Very knowledgeable.  Would highly recommend him to others and will be booking with Captain Ron again.

name: Sam Bright
text: We did an all day trip! Morning trip out was incredible! Put us on some nice bull reds (big redfish) that put up a nice fight! Some of the guys on the boat had never been saltwater fishing and Captain Ron did an amazing job explaining all the different fish species and telling everyone about the gulf! We went back out on a afternoon trip to deep drop on some snapper and once again captain paid off! We pulled some slobs of snapper off a reef! I highly recommend using Captain Ronnie to take you fishing. As a local of the gulf coast he did an amazing job! Thanks Capt!

resp.text: Thank you Sam! Really enjoyed having you and your friends out. Also enjoyed having you help with retrieving the fish and thank you for the help keeping the boat clean. Call me anytime and we will do it again. Thank you!

name: Billy Daugherty
text:
Reel Attraction Charters & Captain Ronnie Black

Excellent experience with superb customer service!

If you’re going deep sea fishing in or around Ft. Morgan, AL and want to have a great experience and get your money’s worth, this is your charter! Our experience was worth this extended review.

Prior to this week, I had been deep sea fishing only once and that was on a “party boat” of sorts. It was an overall bad experience being on a boat with 30 or more people, lines all tangled up, people getting sea sick, etc.

My wife and I had a totally opposite experience with Captain Black. As a matter of fact, we booked and fished three separate charters with three separate companies during our week at the beach. While each experience was pleasurable, for the most part (come on – it’s fishing!), our charter with Reel Attractions was by far THE BEST overall charter experience. The customer service was second to none. From our initial phone call to discuss and schedule the charter, to the phone calls in the days and hours before the charter to discuss weather (Hurricane Nate), Captain Black was prompt, courteous, and patient with all our questions. He was at the dock waiting for us when we arrived (early). The boat was a perfect size with all the necessary amenities. He took time to explain everything to us. We didn’t want for anything. Captain Black was very attentive to our every need, he is very, very personable, he made every effort to make sure we were catching a variety of fish (and we did), he operated safely, and he did a great job cleaning our fish. Captain Black is a consummate professional and my wife and I highly recommend him and Reel Attraction charters.

On a side note, you don’t have to just take my word for it. Not only was our experience with him a stand out of the three experiences we had this week, but it was later validated when we took our haul to a local restaurant who will cook your catch for you. The restaurant staff was asking us about our experience and complimenting the variety of fish we had. Without us even saying his name, the waitress asked, “who did you go fishing with, Captain Ronnie Black?” You might have chosen a reputable charter when the locals attribute a successful catch to certain charters!

resp.text: Thank you for an awesome review!

name: Andrew Collins
text: Ron took my wife and I out on Wed 6-22-16 in the afternoon I caught 2 king mackerel and 3 keeper red snapper one about 8 pounds. Wife got sick and had to bring her back to the dock, Ron took me to fish in the bay, no luck. Over all very good trip! The fresh fish tasted Great!

name: Caleb Greenberg
text: We had a great time with captain Ron!!! He made the experience fun and made sure we caught plenty of fish. Would highly recommend him to anyone on vacation who wants a great deal and a great experience!!!

name: Chandra Stebbins
text: We had no trouble booking our outing with Capt. Ronnie initially.  However, on 5/29/2017, the day that we were supposed  to go out, there were storms off the coast and we could not.  OK,  we understand.  Capt. Ronnie said he would call around to a couple of his Captain buddies to see if someone could take us out on the  31st or June 1st, he never called us.  We had to call him...then he acted like he never heard of us.   Since our trip was cancelled due to weather we have not been able to get in touch with Capt. Ronnie for a refund of our deposit.  We are very disappointed in Reel Attractions.

I rarely do 6 hour charters and if i do and the fish are not biting that day I cut them trips much shorter and prorate the charge. If you departed from Fort Morgan Marina you did not fish with us. I'm sorry you had a bad day when the fish were not active and if I can help you in any way feel free to contact me. 2514228665 Capt. Black.

With recreational and natural areas in such short supply around here, the dysfunctional state should do a better job of promoting this place. Road signs would be a nice first touch.

name: UFE Student
text: Highly recommended! Perry Lakes Park is a definite must-see if in Perry County! Located less than ten miles from Marion, it is a perfect activity to do before a delicious dinner while there. The park itself is huge with plenty of trails to walk on and benches to rest on. In addition, if one walks about ten minutes from the parking lot, Barton's Beach is also there which is beautiful to say the least. Here, a nice, sandy beach touches a peaceful river which is perfect for swimming, canoeing, or whatever else you could put your mind to. Overall, Perry Lakes Park is a must-see while in Marion, Alabama!

name: Darryl Gutierrez
text: This is a museum in the private home of artist and poet (Maria) Howard Weeden. The cost is $5 and the tour is about an hour long. I found it to be a fascinating glimpse into not only Weeden's life and art, but also the early history of Huntsville and North Alabama. Like many private museums, Weeden house has had to branch out to make ends meet so they rent the place out as an event venue as well. This means that Lynn, their lone employee is stretched rather thin as tour guide, event coordinator, curator and hostess so you should make an appointment for the guided tour. Nevertheless, she was as gracious and informative a hostess as you could wish for. Word of caution- there are stairs so if you have mobility issues you may miss the upstairs part of the tour.

name: Ken Barnes
text:
Our wedding and reception was in the back yard of the Weeden House. We had lots of questions and requests, and their event/property manager was incredibly flexible and responsive. It was a magical event, and the Weeden House was a huge part of making it feel special.

Note: it's one of the few facilities in Huntsville that does weddings but allows you to bring your own alcoholic drinks. No forced catering!

name: James Chamberlain
text: Has an expanded exhibit for the Alabama Bicentennial. From February 1-March 7 2019. The home, furnishings, paintings, etc. give a good sense of life before and after the Civil War. Great way to learn more about local Huntsville area history. Guides knowledgeable and helpful.

text:
One of the most significant and influential American signers and songwriters in world history.  This is a beautiful grave site and location in one of the most historic cities in America.  Oakwood Cemetery in general is worth visiting.

Should also visit the nearby Hank Williams museum in downtown Montgomery.

name: Jeremy Jones
text: This is an interesting stop for our vacation. It was truly humbling to visit the grave of Hank Williams Sr. And pay respects to this groundbreaking musician.

text: From his Boyhood home to the museum to his favorite hotdog 🌭 “Chris” spot on down to this place Such a beautiful experience and pieces to add to our road trip! 🤘Rock on Hank Sr

name: Vaughn V
text:
As a child in the early 60s, before being exposed to Grand Funk Railroad and the psychedelic music beyond... Hank Williams was a man who touched a chord with me and anyone who had a heart or had felt/lost love.

After hearing Midnight in Montgomery, I recalled Hank being born and buried in Montgomery AL, so I made plans to visit the gravesite.

I’m from Wichita KS driving to Albany GA, so I listened to every Hank Williams album and collection I could find on Amazon Music, what an eye opening and amazing experience it was.

I can now say I’ve heard almost every Hank Williams tune and especially interesting and insightful was his “live” work with Audrey on radio. Hours of wonderfully uplifting yet equally sad and depressing music which stills touches many of the chords of life.

As regards the gravesite, very respectfully done and until I got there I didn’t realize Audrey was buried beside him. You know, he did have a license to fight, eternally now!!!

It’s a simple drive up to the gravesite with a beautiful view... well worth the small sidestep south if you’re passing just north of Montgomery.

I’m glad I had a chance to “See the Light”

name: Amanda Colletti
text: Very cool gravesight and cemetery!

name: Lee, Moore Sr. Founder: No Rules Internet Radio

text: This needs no explanation.. Powerful & surreal to be standing where my heroes have stood while paying respects to someone who made a mark on the world that CAN'T be erased or covered over.

name: Boone Acton
text: Absolutely beautiful, im 23 and I grew up on Hank and ive always wanted to see this.. he was an amazing man that was taken way before his time. This man made true music. This site is surrounded by marble with 2 large marbles grave stones, one engraved for his wife and the other for him, on his they have some of his music engraved on there as well. Fascinating, a great tribute to a wonderful man. I drove down from Missouri just to pay my respects to such an amazing artist. Youll never be forgotten Hank.

I was by my self.. but I wasn't scared at all. It was peaceful.  I sat at the bench in front of hanks grave and played a few of his songs and spent a few minutes with him. What an experience.

name: Gunars Cazers
text: Great place to camp, visit, not far from Tuscaloosa. We did a day trip here in the winter. The lake is beautiful. There is a spillway at one end where there are picnic tables and restroom - yes, outhouse style, but that's fine. We tried a little hike on the trail marked with blue diamond blazes. The tree markers are great, but no one has done any trail maintenance recently - hard to see where the trail is. There are swimming beaches on both sides of the lake, on one side, they look kind of abandoned. There were also camping sites on both sides of the lakes with fire pit/grills, camping tables, lantern posts. There were many hunting parties camping there. A friendly campsite host/ranger kept a close eye on all goings on in the park. Next time we will bring the canoe!

text: My favorite campground to date. Water, electric, level campsite, picnic table, fire ring and firewood. $9 a day with America the Beautiful Senior Pass. Parked by the lake, gorgeous view of rising mist and reflection of Fall foliage. Hated to leave but weather is coming.

text: Really enjoyed our stay.  We finally found a park that had nothing wrong.   The sites are spacious and well thought out.   The restrooms are well maintained and there is lots to do.   This was a very peaceful place.   We were only going to stay for 2 days, but ended up staying for a week.   We will be back.

text: This is a nice place to visit, but if you are visiting to fish, it may not be for you. The access to the water needs to be greatly improved, and fish attractors (such as fallen trees) need to be added along the shoreline in accessible areas. The grass is often high and if you don't spray yourself really well, you will be covered in ticks. I've never really had much luck fishing here so I make the much longer drive to the Bibb County Lake which is set up much nicer with better water access.

The camp host Ron is awsome makes a presents to let you know he has your back but not in a weird way, he is a true southern gentleman,  I bet he has a lot of story's to tell.

name: Brandon Fowler
text: This is a neat little museum if you're interested in George Washington and that time period. They have several original items and documents of Washington's and many other family heirlooms. They also have original documents from several other founding fathers and presidents. The curator knows all about Washington's life; I learned several things I'd never heard before.

name: Catherine “Best Friend” Marie
text: It took me three weeks to get a chance to go see this museum after hearing about it. I was very excited to make a video on it for those who could not make it to see it. (We explore local places and try to get folks interested in history) I was really disappointed that they would not let me video. Keep in mind that there is no fee to enter the museum. There were three or four rooms of stuff, but none were directly related to Washington, just very distant relatives. Be careful as there are glass pieces sitting on tables and open shelving. Not recommended for children.  It was very hard to read the writings and with it behind the glass, it was almost impossible.It would have been nice if they had been typed out. I can think of several needed improvements.

name: Chris Mosley
text: Thoroughly enjoyed the museum, and the historical context provided by Don the curator was excellent.  Exhibits include original documents, paintings, busts, and family heirlooms. A wonderful collection!

Big rug & other trash taken out of Shades Creek recently.  CBS 42 team & Cahaba R helped too (coverage on 42 news).

name: Kinley Hall
text: I love hiking there, and I love the changes they have made also! It's pretty clean. Lately I've noticed there is A LOT of  yard trinkets. In the beginning there was a decorative deer hidden inside a tree trunk, but on my current hike half way through trail I spotted like a dozen of figurines. As cute and cool as it may be it seemed like an overkill and like someone decored their yard. It kinda distracts you from the nature. Almost becomes like litter. Other than that beautiful place! I love to look for mushrooms there! Find so many kinds especially after rain!

name: Nichole Winters
text: Nice, short, and challenging trail. A few steep hills that make a short distance hard work. Perfect for training. Lots of greenery and poison ivy.

name: Diane Hill
text: Cool little hidden trails.

name: Todd Pierce
text:
Unexpected, almost hidden, city nature preserve along Shades Creek, at the northern base of Shades Mountain, in a neighborhood of extreme southeast Birmingham, on the border of Irondale. The trail is marvelous, and feels like walking at Ruffner Mountain Nature Preserve which is nearby, or Red Mountain Park in west Birmingham. Very popular among people who live in the immediate area, and another gem in Birmingham's crown.
The beauty and unexpected location of this rugged nature park in the middle of a neighborhood combine to create one more reason this place definitely earns its nickname of "The Magic City".

name: Joyce Driggars
text: It's a delightful well kept trail that's easy to hike and explore.  It's well marked and is obviously taken care of. My granddaughter and I enjoy going there.

name: Brooke Dayton
text: This trail is well maintained, it can flood after a big rain and some patches can get muddy. There is one long mostly flat trail if you go straight at the start- or you can  turn right when you first start (my recommendation). turning right takes you to the "upper trail" that is well worth the extra huff and puff to get up to- lovely views at the end of the upper trail- it ends at the powerlines then you go back down to the lower trail and can chose to loop back or keep going on the lower trial.

name: Rae Noling
text: Beautiful space, unfortunately there is a bit of rubbish in the water

name: Barbara Donnelly
text: A community park in the middle of nowhere.

name: Jami Pruitt
text: I really like this little park. I rarely see others there. To get to the trail, you park in the lot which is behind houses (ONE HOUSE HAS BEE HIVES WITH BEES THAT ARE ACTIVE IN WARM WEATHER SO PARK ON THE SIDE OPPOSITE HOUSES IF YOU ARE ALLERGIC OR HAVE KIDS..) and you walk across the bridge on the side and climb over the railing. The trail is a loop but you can start off by going up to the top trail and then returning on the lower trail or vice versa. The trails tend to have muddy spots, nothing you can't go around but if you jog you may want to be prepared to get wet! The elevation is pretty intense, the trail is clearly marked with signs, and the trail is around 1 mile.

name: Brian W. Kittrell
text: Hidden gem! Incredible asset to the neighborhood. During the 20+ years I lived in the neighborhood, I spent many hours walking the trail and was so very surprised how nice it was that we had this hidden nature park right in the middle of the city.

name: Valerie Burnes
text: Beautiful area with nice trails.  Convenient for a quick walk during lunch.  Easy parking access

name: Gottfried Kibelka
text: Nice little park  with dense wildflower populations. ~1 mile loop on a bluff alongside Shades Creek. Park is squeezed into a residential area and from most of the trail houses or yards are visible. Trailhead is blocked by a guard rail on Elder Street but neighbors installed helpful steps to get over the rail. I was very pleasantly surprised by the abundance of wildflowers (early April). Lots of trilium (I saw only cuneatum), rue anemone, woodland phlox, red buckeye, some blue-eyed grass, violets, jack in the pulpits, yellow, white, nd pink wood sorrel , little brown jugs, ..

name: Mark H
text: Didn't go through the camping area, but the lake is very nice inside the park. Not the largest state park in AL, but clean and well kept!

name: chris melville
text: Lightly visited, it's a scenic trail through the woods and along Shades Creek

name: Jessica V
text: Love these hidden trails!

name: Tcpeavy Schofield
text: Good place to go for a walk

name: Bogart Daniel
text: This is a hiking trail. Given no lighting and in residential neighborhood, probably best to plan on daylight hours.

name: Ian MacDonald
text: It was amazing

name: Barry Bailey
text: NEW WALKING TRAILS

name: Allen Evans
text: A hidden gem in Alabama

name: Lost Levi
text: The hike down is very hard and steep. There is a section where you need to hold onto a rope as you decend. The decend is wet and slippery so be careful. Once you reach the bottom go ahead and take a swim. It is cold but also deep and a great swim. Hope this helps have fun!

name: Christy Isbell
text: Very beautiful and higher than what I expected. The trail going in leads you to the top. Be very cautious if you venture any closer. Step and slippery.

name: Your favorite monster
text: It's very run down and I almost died trying to get down to the falls. I don't recommend trying to go down there unless you can climb slippery rocks next to a death drop.

name: David
text: I don't fault a property owner for wanting privacy. I DO fault the Talladega National Forest management and National Forest Service for not purchasing an important scenic resource neighboring public lands for the enjoyment of the public for future generations.

name: Angel Elaine
text: Love coming to this swim hole! Pretty treacherous hike. Wouldn't reccomend bringing small children. Not a long hike, however heading back up the trail on your way out is tiring!

name: Jeff Doby
text: My favorite cheaha waterfall

name: Billy McLeod
text: Very easy to access. Peaceful spot. Went from Camp Mac on excursion.

name: Shannon Sullivan
text: Live this place. It is a great spot to come and just sit on the rocks and reflect on your life.

name: Tim
text: Nice view, and the falls are beautiful. Be prepared for a steep descent to get down there. The rocks can be slippery, so take it very slow.

name: James Underwood
text: We tried unsuccessfully to find parking location or signage, so we called the office at  Mt Cheaha State Park and were advised that the falls are situated on private property and the current owner is not agreeable to visitors and will call the local law enforcement if trespassing occurs. Guess the Salt Creek Falls are “permanently closed” to visitors . Disappointed

name: Michelle Smith
text: It's a locals secret!!  Great for day adventure, camping. You just gotta KNOW.

name: Charon Wileman
text: Did not see it after driving there.  On a gravel road.  No parking.  No place to make an u-turn.  Everything said "no trespassing".   No path to be seen.   Would have had to walk through tall grass.  I was afraid someone was going to catch us trespassing and shoot us or hit our car on that narrow road if we parked on the shoulder.

name: Snip34life
text: It's for more experienced hikers. Pretty intense.

name: Lynn Wilson
text: Hard to find, private and no trespassing signs everywhere. Not a good place for a motorcycle. i was not able to find or reach it due to no markings and dirt road. Rode over 100 miles to see it. Disappointing.

name: jordin sheridan
text: Wonderful

name: C CC
text: Located on cheha mountain

name: John Fischer
text: Waterfall

name: 陳存耀
text: A place surrounded by private land hanging the sign of no transparent. As a hiking guy with no ammo, the best strategy is to leave it alone. I have no interest of being human shaped monkey or deer. Deer season is on November whereas the news tell us everyday is human season.

text:

name: Vladislav Sosnov
text:
(Translated by Google) A clean mountain river, mountain trail, forest, fresh air, beautiful views, a waterfall and a small lake where you can swim, all this you will get by visiting this place. Of the minuses, they are also pluses, the inaccessibility of the place which makes it a bit wild and at the same time so mysterious and alluring in my personal experience the best place to swim within a radius of 70 miles

(Original)
Чистая горная речка, горная тропа, лес, свежий воздух, красивые виды, водопад и небольшое озеро в котором можно купатся всё это вы получите посетив это место. Из минусов они же и плюсы, труднодоступность места что делает его немного диким и в тоже время таким загадочным и манящим по моему личному опыту лучшее место для купания в радиусе 70 миль

name: John Mitchell
text: Nice camping. Right on the water. Very quiet. I stayed there while I was working but will definitely be back for a vacation. Rv sites are priced really good. The cabins seemed a little high but looked like they were new.

name: Curtis Williamson
text: Beautiful park. Grounds were very well maintained.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.

name: Jodi Presley
text: The Park is good. We rented a cabin and not so much. $115 a night plus $25 for our pet. No paper towels, 1 roll of toilet tissue. No dish liquid, no hand soap, no bath soap or shampoo. The pots and pans were horrible. There was only 1 pot that wasn't scratched and rusty. Furniture is very old and has old, nasty covers on it. We have stayed before, but it has gone way down.

name: Rick Bidgood
text: Lovely setting, campsites are nicely spaced, the picnic table and the fire pit were too far away from our vehicle.

name: Cal and Dar Lawley
text: This is our first time at Roland Cooper and we love it! It is so quiet and so peaceful. Lots of birds and beautiful nature to photograph. Not bad fishing either! We will definitely be back!

name: Bart Fisher
text: Very pretty park and campground. The folks that run the campground are really nice and accommodating. I was looking for a small broom and dust pan at the camp store. She offered to let me use hers. How sweet is that?!?

name: Wayne P
text: This is a nice, quiet park. There is a good bit of space between the back-in sites, and they are all relatively level and paved. The pull through sites are all gravel, close to the road, and somewhat rutted from the rain. The water and electric hookups looked new, or at least, very recently undated. The bathhouses looked updated, too. There was more construction going on in the area of the dock. There are two hiking trails (though we didn't take either due to the rain). The campground is heavily wooded. Now, that is  not a problem for at leasts our 38 foot motorhome, and we appreciate the shade on hot Alabama days. The down side is, if you have satellite TV you may have problems getting a clear shot at the sky. The biggest problem for us is, the only cell phone service that worked in the park was Verizon. Since we didn't have Verizon, we couldn't even use the phone, much less do email or surf the web. But, if you want to disconnect for a while, this could be a good place to do it.

name: Julie Dodd
text: Very peaceful and beautiful!  Sue and her husband, campground managers, were so nice and helpful.  We will definitely be visiting again!

name: Scott Shaw
text: Very well maintained campground with friendly and helpful staff. The tiny cabins are well done and very clean. Excellent park.

name: Amber Little
text:
My husband brought my son and I here for the first time. This place is so beautiful and the staff is so sweet. If you want a great getaway! This is where you come. Timeshare doesn't compare to this. Thank y'all so much for this amazing family memory!!!
The Henderson family!

name: Teresa Cartee
text: It's a great place to go. My family goes every year. The people that run it are amazing!!!!

name: James Napper
text: Enjoy every time I go. Wish there was an easier place to put the kayaks in. Management are super helpful and friendly.

name: Brad Rainey
text: We stay here all the time during the fall and winter and are extremely satisfied with the place. The staff is super friendly and they remember you which makes you want to continue coming back. The bathrooms and showers are ALWAYS clean and stocked. Can't stress enough of how nice this place is.

name: Meagan Cauley
text: Very clean. Great boat launch with plenty of parking. Clean bathrooms. Very pretty lake

name: Dave C.
text: Nice place to launch, plenty of parking. The parking area could have been more lighted but thats being picky! I will be going back to stay a night or 2 very soon!

name: Daniel Tibbitts
text: We stayed in cabin 24. It was very clean, nice and comfortable! There was a dock on the water below the cabin, and the water is close enough to see. The entire park is well kept and clean. The staff was helpful as well! I cannot wait to go back!

name: Karen Hughey
text: We stayed at Roland Cooper State Park in December 2020.  We loved this campground!  It was well-maintained and the sites were a good distance apart.  We had a site overlooking the river and it was absolutely beautiful.  We enjoyed walking the trails with our dogs during the day and sitting by the fire at night.  Will definitely visit this campground again.

name: Kathy McAtee
text: Quiet, secluded camping spot on well maintained sites along the Alabama River. Good base for visiting Selma. If you're a fisherman, this is a great spot.

name: Agnes Arrington
text: I stayed in cabin #21 and it was so impressive! I wasn’t expecting to find such a clean, well kept place waiting for me, just like a motel room ~ everything provided from the time you open the door ~ I even had a screened in front porch, lol ~ it opened into a large living room/kitchen/dining area; then walk through hallway, immediately to your left was the largest bathroom with shower that I’ve ever seen; go down hallway to a very large bedroom ready for me to just relax and enjoy!! Did not have to worry about anything except bringing whatever food I wanted to eat, how marvelous is that?!  I also enjoyed nature at its finest, a walk around the campsite meeting new people, smell of clean air, hear sound of water in the lake and birds ~ to me it’s a place I intend to come to more often ~ plus, you can’t beat the staff who run the place, they make you feel special and really are helpful if/when you need it..I highly recommend Roland Cooper State Park! You’ll love it too!

name: Gypsy Soul
text: Truly a gem. Great primitive camping right on the Alabama river. Great fishing right from your camp. Mostly everyone ive met here is very nice and friendly and would give you the shirt off their back. Deer walk right through your campsite. They have chameleons. Gators in the area as well!

name: Scott Krug
text: Really nice park. Camped at a primitive site. Good fishing and facilities.

name: Diane Rhodes
text: This place is wonderful~! Beautiful state park with primitive camping, cabins, and RV hookups. The boat ramp and water is gorgeous! Plenty of restrooms, including showers. There's even a game cleaning station! You can purchase a bundle of firewood for $5 or four bundles for $18. The staff is amazing! We rented a two-bedroom cabin and it's kitchen is fully equipped with even pots and dishes. All we had to do is bring food, dish soap, and paper towels; the paper towels and dish soap can be purchased at the park store. Our beds were comfortable. The couch has a hide-a-bed as well. We love staying at state parks but we are genuinely impressed with Roland Cooper State Park!

name: Andy Beasley
text: Great little cabins, they are very nice.  The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly!

name: Robert Ball Jr
text:
I was most impressed with the availability, helpfulness, and friendliness of the staff here. Some friends and I rented a cabin for a weekend get-together. The cabin decor is a little dated, however, everything worked and the beds were comfortable. DISHTV was available in our cabin. You must make your own bed with the linens provided. This is a new policy since the first of the year, they say to cut cost. Read the rules and there will be no other surprises. There are some basic necessities and firewood available at the office. We are planning to return for another visit.

Update: Made another visit with friends on the 2nd weekend of February 2020. Staff was friendly and helpful. This campground is well tended. Awesome experience!!

name: Daryl Bailes
text: A great place to relax and enjoy some down time.  Beautiful scenery but not much of a view of the water.

name: Susan Avery
text: Amazing place.... manager's Don and Sue are great

name: Clay Morris
text: Great place to stay for the money!

name: JoAnne Smith
text: Not the greatest for $36 a night. They did have sewer hookup, but no Wi-Fi. For that price I expect Wi-Fi as well. Not much to do in the area.

name: Dubert Pettis
text: A wonderful place to go and fish and to just get away

name: Laurie Wiggins
text: Nice and quiet. Good, dog friendly option for a mini vacation.

name: Robert Hunnicutt
text: Can bring your boat and rv camp and fish kids can ride bikes

name: G0lf
text: Awesome campground.  Very quiet and clean with nice staff.  We will definitely go back.

name: Jamshed Arslan
text: Lovely beautiful place focused on camping, fishing, and boating.

name: Patsy Hadley
text: Awesome  place. Our favorite  place to fish and camp. Clean restrooms and  showers  friendly hosts  guaranteed to make you feel  like family.

name: AudreySue Littleton
text: I work as camp Host at this park. We have wonderful people in management The Park is so pretty and well kept. If you have to see this park.

name: Dee Afasano
text: Amazing staff. They take great pride in this park. Shower was amazing. River was awesome. Five stars is not enough.

name: Louise Pousson
text: Excellent staff, beautiful park, and deer roaming everywhere.

name: The Sextons
text: We had a group for a church family retreat. The RV camping were clean and level and the kids had plenty of room to play. There were various games available to check out at the park office as well as a basketball goal. Each campsite has a fire pit. Cabins mixed in with the camp sites made it an excellent choice for our group. The park staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating, even leaving the washer/dryer open late for us to finish our laundry. We will definitely come back.

name: Lindsay Williams
text: We stay at a lot of rv parks across the country and this was one of the most pleasant. Nice separation between lots and friendly staff.

name: Sherry Caskey
text: The bathrooms and showers are very clean. The workers are super nice. The camper ground is very clean and quiet. It's a nice place to go and camp with family and friends.  We go 2 or 3 times a year. My husband loves to fish there.

name: Stacy Peeples
text: Hands down the best place to camp for the outdoor enthusiast, whether it's hunting, fishing, bird watching, etc. My husband and I have camped her many times the last 10 years. Updated boat launch, water and power hookups for the camping sites, and restrooms and showers, along with new cabins and we look forward to more upgrades in the future. This park is well managed. The management and the staff are great, always making us feel welcome! We are always recommending Roland Cooper to anyone we know and meet that love to camp, whether it's primitive camping or campers. We are alligator hunters and outdoor enthusiasts, and it has become our favorite place to camp.

name: DeRonda Wages
text: Only reason a 4 and not a 5 is the limited number of nice spots. But,Wow, the spots that are nice are very nice. Great accommodating hosts.

name: Kenny Boatwright
text: Roland Cooper is a great place to visit. Cabins are very nice and they are clean. My family stays at least once a year. We would live there if possible Lol!  Fishing is great as well! I would recommend Roland Cooper to anyone who wants a nice and quiet get away.

name: David hatchett
text: Wonderful place great staff will definitely be going back

name: Michael Cooper
text: Enjoyed our stay excellent service and very clean!!! Will be back

name: Kale Nelson
text: Great state park

name: Cindy Anderson
text: We loved it!  Had all we needed except soap and paper towels, but no problem and we will know next time.  The check in was so easy and the folks were super nice.  It was clean and short walk to our dock.

name: James Tennyson
text: Beautiful small cabins in a wooded, shady area! I hate to say how much I enjoyed it, because I don't want it to be crowded the next time I go!!

name: James Boswell
text: I camped at this park in January. This is a very secluded park, back in the pine trees, on the river, with fishing from the park. It is secluded so bring all you will need while there. I give the park 3 thumbs up.riverwith walking trails and fishing on

name: Donnie Byrne
text: Camp site was beautiful - grounds well kept - with so many golf carts it would be nice it the garbage could be picked up at the camp site by a certain time, as many campgrounds do.  A great stay! Personnel very nice!

name: Tracy Ryals
text: The restroom was spotless! Park attendant was very  when discussing cabins rentals.

name: Barbara Primmer
text: Very nice park we have  really enjoyed our stay. The parks management are very helpful and friendly. Only wish there were activities or more to do. We will be back next year. Beautiful place and really kept up. Looking forward to next year.

name: Jim Esmond
text: This is a very nice place to visit. We were there in mid July so it was very warm. We plan to come back when it's cooler so we can enjoy it more. It was very quiet and the staff was great.

name: Mary Lamkin
text: Beautiful location,  you can stay in a tent,  a mini cabin or one of the beautiful bigger cabins.  They also have RV hookups. They have a boat landing with patrols to make sure the parking lot Is safe. They have a super staff

name: Steve Cox
text: We have family vacations at least twice a year at Roland Cooper.  We always have a great time! The kids ride bikes, hike, and fish! Never once do they even think about video games! The staff is always so friendly and accommodating! We will continue to have family adventures with you!

name: Sherry Reed
text: Great stay!!

name: Kerry Merrell
text: Another beautiful weekend at Roland Cooper. Been coming here for 2 years and always a great time. Staff is friendly & helpful, park is kept very clean. Love Roland Cooper.

name: Jennifer Blair
text: This is a very clean, quite park. Our camp sites were very large. The camp hosts were all wonderful. But you better bring plenty of bug spay!!!

name: Leslie New
text: We love it up there. Its so peaceful and quite. And the staff and especially the park managers are so friendly and nice and always go above and beyond to make sure we are always took care of and not in need of anything!!! We miss it every time we go back home

name: Kevin Bingham
text: Excellent Park to go to for the day or extended periods of time. The restrooms at the picnic area are very clean and the park is easy to navigate. We enjoyed our time there with family and friends during the last three months.

name: Sam Bollinger
text: Fun, great people working there. Had a blast

name: Ann Riley

name: Greg Nolen

name: Cynthia Russell
text: This park was so what we needed this weekend.  The tiny cabin was adorable and had everything you could want.  The park staff was so welcoming and friendly.  We rented a little boat and trolling motor and spent a beautiful day fishing and swimming.  Can't wait to go back!!!!

name: Nervousdelta
text: Have camped there over the years. The new cabin are super compact but still are very nice. Our last experience with a older cabin would have been a 1 star because whoever cleaned it before we got there didn't do a very good job. Nothing stinks worse than going to relax and enjoy yourself and having to clean as soon as you get there. Other than that it was great.

name: artsmonster
text: My wife and I tried to go primitive camping at Roland Cooper this past weekend. I am in a wheelchair and need oxygen constantly. So I chose to be secluded and brought a generator for my equipment and a fan. My wife is 71 yrs old. After the second day, in 90+ degrees heat and no shade we decided the rest of our 5 day vacation was either going to be in a cabin, or we were leaving. My wife went to the office to ask about a cabin. One was avail, so we booked that for the remaining 3 days. We asked since no one was in the camping area could we please take our time after sunset to remove our tent, cooking stove, etc. Laura in the office said no problem at all. In about 10 minutes Donnie pulls up in a golf cart. He said another man was coming in a truck. When he got there, they were going to pack our things for us and bring everything to the cabin. Paul arrived in 5 minutes, told us not to do anything but tell him how we want things done. He and Donnie took down our tent, packed our things, put our coolers and dry food in their truck. They drove our things to the cabin and brought everything in for us. In 90+ degree heat, and not even being asked. These people saved our vacation, and with me being in a wheelchair, and my wife's age, made our workload very easy. I wrote several reviews, and am writing you. We will be back, but when its cooler!!

name: Betty Brown
text: We stayed in one of the little cabins.  The staff responded positively to any need we had. It's a great place to spend some time.

name: Nikki Sellers
text: We love Roland cooper! Quiet and beautiful.. the host here are excellent

name: Oscar Almeida
text: This has to be one of the best maintained campgrounds that I've ever visited.  The staff went out of their way to help out and are always working on the grounds. Thank you

name: Robert Childress
text: Great camp ground would recommend to anyone quite and peaceful.

name: Thomas Anderson
text: Nice park, camping, very pleasant place.

name: Christy Deason
text: Very relaxing. All the staff were so friendly and accommodating. The cabins have everything you need. Just take your food, fishing equipment and yourself.

name: Aranda Halter
text: People who work there are remarkable

name: BOB RAINEY
text: Rob and Tammie enjoyed the water at Roland Cooper State Park

name: Trish A
text: Beautiful!  Riverside cabins were fantastic. Fully stocked kitchen utilities,  just bring your food. Staff very friendly.

name: Lynette Thames
text: Loved the fishing and relaxation.  Every one there are very nice and helpful. Will definitely be back

name: Lori Terry
text: Beautiful campground but the cabins are extremely bad. Furniture very dirty.

name: Wendy Dawley
text: My husband and I were able to visit Roland Cooper State Park for the first time for our 1 year wedding anniversary. Visiting another state and an unfamiliar campsite, we were both eager to see what the camp site had to offer. They had a very clean and accommodating primitive camping area (our camp site was next to the river). They also had a fire pit with a grill top at each camp site, which was very enjoyable to cook hotdogs, hamburgers, and smores on. We were also given the opportunity to rent either kayaks or a small boat with a motor -- we ended up renting the boat with a motor. We had one of the best times out on the water although we got rained out within the first 30 minutes of boating. Our little weekend was a beautiful and relaxing experience thanks to the accomodating staff and the park's features. Thanks Roland Cooper State Park!

name: Wendy Smith
text: This park is amazing..so beautiful and peaceful..our own little piece of heaven

name: Bonnie Mahler

text: Beautiful homes, but we almost felt like we were intruding. It’s a very nice walk right around some obstacles, but with gorgeous views of the bay and the homes.

text: It is a beautiful place for a walk in good weather. You need to pay attention to the conditions as there are some minor obstacles. It is truly serene. Walk along the bay and enjoy the bay.

name: Linda Schwemin
text: Beautiful!

name: Richard Kiefl
text: A visit to the past. Park at the end of Battlefield Rd. And walk along the boardwalk . The antibellum homes on one side and piers on the water side. You'll end up at Sacred Heart Chapel. Takes about 40 minutes. It's unbelievable!

name: Terry Mims
text: I'm not sure why it's called, A Walk to Remember. It's a nice stroll by some really pretty houses.

name: Katrese Roberson
text: Beautiful!!!

name: Fritz “Fred” Pierce
text: Beautiful

name: Sky Jett
text: Lots of old treasures here. You can learn all about the mining history of this town but also so much more. About the way of life back then. One of the first washing machines, an old cash register, typewriters, baseball stuff, even an eye exam chair can be found here. There's something special seeing toys that little hands touched so long ago. I could spend hours here.

name: Patricia Self

I actually viewed buy Maps and the Wonders and excellent things that are inside I can't wait to see! I thought that my ancestors could add something to it but I don't know

text: This was a fantastic trail, easy, but hilly enough to be interesting, pretty views, cows nearby and creeks to cross. We did miles 4.5 to 3 and back.

name: David Imm
text: Duck River is an awesome place to mountain bike. But be prepared to get off your bike and be smart. If you try to ride over all the rocks he'll end up taking your bike to the repair place.

name: a baker
text: The trail was well marked and great for walking, but the sludge and garbage in the water was disgusting and smelled horrible.  The buzzing power lines in part of the trail sounded like a waterfall inspiring us to walk further.  The map online led us to a small parking space and we saw no signage on 278 for the recreation area.  Very disappointing

name: Michael Winston

name: Steve West
text:
I have enjoyed it since before the reservoir was filled with water. It is intermediate difficulty (nothing too strenuous) with beautiful lake scenery, plenty of rocks and streams, and a nice view of the new dam. As of 9/2017, they have finished about 3/4 of what will be a 26 mile loop. There are 4 ways to access it. Starting from the Cullman end of the trail and moving to the Holly Pond end of the trail,

1. On Hwy 69 in Fairview, go west toward Cullman past Fairview town limits. Turn left (south) on Co Rd 1534 (on the western edge of the white fences at Haynes farm.) Then turn right on Co Rd 1656. Bear left and drive 2 miles. Turn left on Co Rd 1651. In 1 mile, it dead ends at one end of the trail (as of 9/17). This is being developed as a boat ramp entrance.

2. On Hwy 69 in Fairview, drive west toward Cullman to the second yellow light at Fairview town limits. Turn left (south) on County Road 1662 (at  sign for Antioch Missionary Baptist). Go 1.5 miles, dog leg Left-Right at Antioch Church. You are now on Co. Rd. 1660, and it dead ends in 2 miles. Park and it's a short walk down the hill and through the wooden gate. This is less than 2 miles from the end of the trail above (as of 9/2017).

3. From Holly Pond, head west on Hwy 278. Pass the white fences on the right with the sign to the cowboy church at the edge of the fence. Take a right Co Rd 1651 (not the road with the small junk yard, the next road opposite a sign for Duck River Baptist). When the road widens, you will come to the new handicapped accessible pier on the left. Park and this is the other end of the trail (as of 9/2017).

4. Follow directions #3 from Holly Pond but keep  going past the pier. A couple of miles farther, the road will end at the main trailhead. This is lessc than 4 miles from the end of the trail (as of 9/2017).

The trail is nice, though it washes out and there is a large tree down. Not sure if it continues past that point, will have to bring waders and boots next time to see. However, there is no trash can at all in this stretch of the refuge! The result is tons of litter everywhere, along the road, the gravel drive, the parking areas, in the brush by the trail, in the river, everywhere you look.
I always bring a bag to pick up, but the staff at Joe Wheeler NWR really need to put trash receptacles by the road or at the trail head. The resources and time required to clean up litter would be better spent on prevention and weekly emptying of a couple trash cans. It blows my mind there is not one in the entire area...

name: Nicholas Blackstock
text:
This place gets 5 stars because there are no apparent downsides that I've ever noticed. Easy to find, just a few minutes of hwy 280.

Truthfully speaking, I've never been inside the larger museum room and am not exactly sure what all it entails. This review is specific to this building being used as a party/event venue. I've been on 3 separate occasions now (2 holiday parties and a baby shower) and have always had a good time. You can setup the room however you'd like with tables, chairs, microphone, speakers etc. There's also kitchen space and easily accessible restrooms to take advantage of.

On this same side of the building where parties can be hosted, there's also a little bit of interactive museum stuff... fun!! Some cool pictures and historical information displays can be found throughout this room as well! Brick walls, high open ceilings and all the rustic decor makes this place feel unique, authentic and like any other event venue that you'll find in Birmingham (that I know of).

text: Visited today with my husband. We did not make it out but we had a great time trying. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Props were nicely done and in keeping with the period of our mystery. name: J Few
text: My family did the wonder land room and made it out with only mins to spare. This was our first time doing a escape room. It was a great experience and we will be doing more. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. I would highly recommend for everyone to go see them for a great time.

name: Elizabeth Zimmerman
text:
Escape rooms have become quite a "thing," but here's one that showcases what's special about Huntsville. In the Von Braun room you'll find authentic vintage props, cool surprises, and puzzles so challenging that you'll really feel like they were set up by a German rocket scientist. The staff is also awesome and will do everything they can to help you have fun.

Note that the address google currently gives (Madison Square Mall) is incorrect. The new one is 3322 South Memorial Parkway.

resp.text: Hey Elizabeth, I know it's been a few weeks, but I wanted to reach out and let you know how much I appreciated this fantastic review! We really strive for both the local connection and for authenticity, and it sounds like you felt we nailed them both. I just thought I'd tell you I'd seen this and that I was REALLY happy to see it. Come back any time! - Jason Steinhauser, Owner

name: Blazedy
text: Four stars only due to price.  Wonderful experience in Von Braun room.  Easy going atmosphere and challenging but solvable puzzles made it fun for my family of four with 12 and 14 yo.  We will return to do the other rooms.  Highly recommend doing it for a fun family/friends time.

name: Larry Morris
text:
Spy Room
My group visited the Escape Pod (Spy Room) tonight. Each one in our group of six had a GREAT time working together trying to figure out the clues. The hour goes by very quickly. We did not make it out before the alotted time but will be going back for another attempt. I highly recommend this to anyone.

text: This was awesome! I recently went there with a few friends. The puzzles were challenging, the staff was nice, and I had fun (albiet not beating the room!) I recommend going here!

name: Danielle Warren
text:
Note - They ARE NOT at Madison Square mall, they are on memorial parkway near Hollywood 18. Go past Hollywood 18 and you will see some buildings with small businesses in them. There are two right next to each other labeled 500 then 600, go into the parking lot between them. You want building 700, so go through that parking lot and up the ramp at the back. If you get to Osborne's Jewelers you've passed it. The owner says he is trying to get it changed on Google but until then maybe this will help.

Review - Some friends and I went last night (their opening night) and were the last group of the evening. We had an absolute blast. The puzzles were really well designed and we all got so excited when we got a box unlocked or found a key. The only room open now is the Von Braun room, but they are also working on a spy room and an Alice in Wonderland room and we will definitely be back. The owner and staff were all super nice and talked to us for a little bit afterwards about the upcoming rooms and the design of the Von Braun room. We all had a great time!

resp.text: Hey, Danielle, thanks for the review! I know it's been a few weeks but I wanted to let you know I was glad to see this. I really appreciate the endorsement, and I hope you've had a chance to try our newest room! - Jason Steinhauser, Owner

text: Clever and challenging puzzels. I love how they incorporated Huntsville's unique history with the von Braun room.

resp.text: Glad you liked that part, Zach! We're really proud of that room (and all our rooms!) and I'm happy to see that you had a lot of fun here. Hope you'll be back again soon to try our newest room! - Jason Steinhauser, Owner

name: Phiwat Klomkaew
text:
My friends and I tried Von Braun out on Friday 13th night (they gave out discount promotion for Friday 13th so be checking on their Facebook page for any deals they might have.), and it was definitely a great decision! Though we did not beat the clock, we had fun developing team-working skill and bonding as a group. Staffs were super friendly and helpful. Even though this business is fairly new and less advertised, Escape Pod has the quality to become one of the best escape-type games around. (I've tried other escape places before)

I highly recommend Escape Pod to anyone of any age. Your mind will be challenged with fun puzzles that you will feel like a kid again. Being able to solve some or all of these puzzles, you will feel like you can do anything in the world!

Make sure you call them if you got lost trying to find the place! Escape Pod really needs a big sign at the turn on Memorial Parkway and in front of the business building.

name: Olivia Dean
text:
Worst escape experience, and getting worse.

I would describe their rooms as "small town church haunted hayride" level, at best, and I'm not trying to be mean because the staff was great. They have a few cool gadgets, but it seems like they were just handed to a group of college kids who were told to "pick a theme and build an incohesive escape room."

We've done about 15 rooms at about 9 different companies across Chattanooga, Nashville, Knoxville, and Atlanta, and we definitely know how to enjoy everything from extreme low budget to extreme difficulty (down to 8% completion rate.) However, the steps to completion for the two rooms we did at Escape Pod were either so simple that it was silly or required huge logic jumps.

After leaving this review on their Facebook page, the (I presume) manager responded by insulting our sportsmanship and insisting that our opinions were invalid because veterans who have played "as many and more" escape rooms than us said "they ranked among the best." I feel sorry for them thinking they would rank anywhere in the top of anyone's escape experiences.

At this point, I'm appalled by their customer service and just hoping that no other Escape Room veterans are suckered into wasting their money on this or, more so, thinking your suggestions are worth anything to whatever ignorant college kids are running this.

name: Marsha Graves
text: Holy Ground is a wonderful large day park (no camping). Open April 1st through Labor Day with a great boat ramp area that is open year long 24 hrs a day. Overlook area offers history of this area (see website) & is high up overlooking the Alabama river. Offers a terrific covered area that is great for weddings, restrooms, tables & grills, basketball court, large pavilion, nature trail through woods to ramp area. Lower park area is huge and offers a maintained & buoyed off beach area for swimming  on the creek, tables, grills, bathhouse with showers, 2 pavilions for rental, fishing dock on larger part of creek, birding area with tables & grills, nature path from beach around to river into bird area. Possibilities are endless hiking, biking, fishing, boating, swimming, family reunions, birthdays. Much to see & do here.

This is the Wetumpka Impact Crater Historical Marker.  There are 5 markers in the Wetumpka Area.

The other four markers are: The Bartram's Trail Marker near the New PostOffice, The Alabama State Penitentiary Marker at the intersection of Hwy 231 and Hwy 14, The Wetumpka Bridges Marker under the bridge on the east side, The William Lowndes Yancey Marker at  Old Hwy 231 and Jasmine Hill Rd.

name: Rod Moody
text: When I was 10 years old in 1951 we moved to Ridgecrest.... I am now 79...This park was there then.... All it had was some really nice swings and a Basketball net on the grass... There was a a softball area but it just appeared by us using that area as such...Not something really built by the city.. There was a shallow grass ditch that ran thru the middle and went out on Oak St. The grass was very nice and kept. However we never saw any city workers, ever. There was a couple of large bushes and a shade tree... We looked for 4 leaf clovers in the grass...There was actually 4 ways to enter the park....Bart Starr and family lived on National Ave. near that entrance....Everybody hung out in the park with their dogs and bicycles.....I got to ride my first motorcycle in the park...I was 13...Jerry Palmer let me ride his Harley 165... Gatewood Walden also rode his 165 to the park sometime. There was never any rules against anything and it all went great...no problems. Usually there would only be a handful of kids in the park.... No crowds...Never saw any grownups... Hope maybe some older folks comment on their early years in Ridgecrest,,,,I enjoyed my time living there... Rodney

text:
Great hidden treasure and the school garden is amazing. Will visit again and post pictures. Not a huge area, but great walking track and the couple of trails looked inviting. The kids play area was clean, the recycled turf is great for their miniature limbs, and plenty of families were there without overcrowding.

Don't look for grilling or pavilions here, but just a quiet, nice, relaxing stroll or trek, this can definitely fit the bill.

name: a x v a n I I
text: Blue Ridge Nature Trail is not as good as I thought it was. As you first go in through the gates, it is hard to spot the entrance to the trail. Not only that, it is very gloomy and almost looks as if nobody has been there in a long long time. The trail is great for hiking but is very bushy and home to some snakes I spotted when I was there. Not only that, the map seems old and outdated along with the trail being very small. I do not think it would be a great place for someone who loves hiking to go and hike there. I also forgot to mention the creek is not the type of creek you would think. It is dried up and has no type of marine life whatsoever. But as I said, i do not recommend this place at all for anybody to go hiking or walk the trail.

name: Gary Shaw
text: Interesting history site. State run. Knowledgeable tour guide. Large amount of original artifacts. Site could use some improvements to the grounds to bring it to a more attractive site.

name: Rodney Smith (Photographer)
text: General Joe Wheeler served in both the Confederate and Federal armies. He was the kind of uniter that we need now. The grounds and home are undergoing renovations to give you a feel for the 19th Century. History is being exposed for both master and slave! This is a worthwhile short trip out of modern Decatur.

name: Glen Adams
text: A fascinating guided tour and beautiful grounds to stroll around.  A perfect place for a picnic.

name: Michael Brown
text: Great historic home and property of General Joe Wheeler.  Contains all original furnishings and personal items owned by the Wheeler family. Two houses, two cemeteries and several outbuildings are there as well as an ancient Native American mound/midden dating back to around A.D. 900. Guided tours are given every hour and mine was excellent. My guide was extremely knowledgeable and informative and was a wealth of information. Gift shop is on site. Admission was just $8 or $5 for seniors, active military, and less for children. I highly recommend visiting here, especially if you are interested in history and/or old houses.

name: Mary Matchen
text: Very nice place to visit!

name: diana canty
text: This was an amazing home!! All of the furniture, books, and family items were from the Wheeler family. Our tour guide was the best! Her enthusiasm for the Wheeler family and their history was contagious!! I will be back to see more as the other house is to be opened later.

name: Richard Hartselle
text: Our guide, Pam, was extraordinary! Pam's ability to share her vast knowledge of the houses, furniture, out buildings, grounds, and most of all the history was phenomenal and delivered with just enough humanity and humor. Her comprehensive information and professional demeanor enhanced my tour experience immeasurably.

name: Brett Bradshaw
text: A wonderful historic home. The tour was enchanting, and our guide was amazing:  both knowledgeable and gracious.  Our visit was exceptionally memorable.

name: Walla Hatchee
text: "The Joseph Wheeler Plantation, commonly known as Pond Spring or the General Joe Wheeler Home, is a historic plantation complex and historic district in the Tennessee River Valley in Wheeler, Alabama. The property contains twelve historically significant structures dating from 1818 to the 1880s."
