I thought this was crazy so I called the night before prom to confirm and they said yes they would be charging $15 per person to be allowed in for pictures, I even stated clearly that we just wanted pics with a phone not a real photographer and still they said we would have to have buy the pass. Which is ridiculous when on any other day the place is free to enter. Prom alone already cost so much I couldn’t afford to pay $45 just for me and my date and his mom to take pictures of us with her cell phone. The day of prom it poured rain so I ended up not having any pictures at all since everywhere else in town is outdoors, while the group we had intended to take pictures somewhere else with ended up going to Lowe mill and nobody made them pay for a thing. I was completely put off and I’ll never be able to go back and enjoy it the same again.

name: Vickie Smith
text: Super cool artsy community to find originals!!

name: Jesse Latimer
text: Always fun to walk around the art studios and meet people! There's always something going on, and of course I get to visit Piper & Leaf too. :-D Lowe Mill is on the top of my list of places to take visitors to Huntsville.

name: Justin Richards
text: Really enjoyable to walk through and check out all of the artists, and the varied styles of everyone involved.

name: Nghia Huynh
text: One of the coolest places to visit in all of Huntsville. The Lowe Mill contains a variety of local art, food, and accessory vendors. They occasionally offer live music performance out on the lawn and art classes all year round. It's a great spot for families and all ages alike.

name: Mathew Clements
text: Excellent use of an old industrial era building.  The artists we friendly but things were pricey.

name: Aimee Minter
text: Love love love this place! There's always something to do. Shows, comedians, dancing, zumba classes, concerts, food, different kid friendly  events, painting, art. The building itself is even interesting. The property is nicely cleaned up. Lots of parking. There's 3 floors you can climb the stairs or ride the elevator. They have a farmers market on Saturday's You can explore the inside buy art, homemade jewery, all kinds of pretty things, baked goodies, there a couple photo studios, a comic book area, a few restaurants, even get a cartoonist draw a picture of you.

name: Arthur Reynolds
text: Interesting place to browse for things of the arts and crafts category. Several classes on how to make things are held here too. The building is massive and easy to get lost in and around.

name: Sheri Spuhl
text: Gotta love this place just as a creative indulgence & motivator. It's a feast for your eyeballs. It's a fun day trip. We like the music nights in the warm weather.

name: Brian Presson
text: Lowe Mill has intriguing artwork displays to tour through on all three floors, with the sale of beverages and t-shirts located at ground level to keep visitors preoccupied. There is also a pool table for everyone to share. I stop by here many times when entering Huntsville to see what exhibits they have for the week. I have talked to a few of the workers, and all of them have interesting stories to share about themselves. Admittance is free.

name: chloe-symone barnett
text: If you love art, and like to support local artists or get commissioned work done, you'll like this neat place. There are food options, tea options etc. There is quite a bit to see here, check it out. One place id suggest an art enthusiast visiting huntsville to go.

name: Hannah Restrepo
text: It's a good place for kids. Staff is a little low. The staff is is knowledgeable about the classes they teach. My sister goes here for a Dungeons and Dragons class. I wrote her opinion.

name: Live Concerts
text: Really cool and artsy place. If you can figure out where the entrance is, you'll have a good time.

name: Lexy Senft
text: So stimulating to see so much art and the lenses through which others view the world. Lots of vegan options around when it comes to food. Poetry slams and live music. Easily one the best spots to visit in Huntsville.

name: sheila larson
text: First of all,  what a great use of an old building! Tons of interesting artwork and artists.  On weekends they have an artist "flea market" called the flying monkey.  I can spend way to much time and money there.  Painters, potters, woodworkers, yarn arts,  quilters,  mixed media. There are a couple eateries/cafe's, coffee shops, even a place that makes popcicles! And it's a dog friendly space.  I noticed one of the eateries had a dog tie out area. I haven't tried out any of the eateries,  but they must be pretty good because they're always busy.  If you have some time to kill,  or out of town guests who like to shop, it's a great place to spend a few hours. Some of the artists teach classes too.  One of these daddy's,  it's my intention to sign up for one.

name: chaithanya kompella
text: Amazing art and inspiring artists !

name: Howard Rochelle
text: Always a good environment. Friendly people, so many artists, and open doors all along tbe hallways. Great place to meet your local artists and get more involved.

name: Elizabeth Niedfeldt
text: Very cool artist studios!  The history of the building is incredible with multiple floors and hallways! We went there trick-or-treating,  it was busy, but fun for my granddaughter! Would go again to listen to music....!

name: Jesse Latimer
text: Always fun to walk around the art studios and meet people! There's always something going on, and of course I get to visit Piper & Leaf too. :-D Lowe Mill is on the top of my list of places to take visitors to Huntsville.

name: Victoria Bailey
text: You can spend hours and hours here talking with local artists and connecting with people in the community! I visit Lowe Mill everytime I'm in AL and it's great to see the growth and improvements going on here! I'm looking forward to my next visit!

name: David Wallner
text: Lowe Mill is awesome. Saw Funkmaster Seeds! Jam out. Earlier we were invited into the Tangled Strings, where outkast's producer was speaking.

name: Grant Stephens
text: Lowe Mill is Huntsville's hangout spot for those who enjoy a chill environment. This place is clearly targeted toward millennials/Gen Zs. It is a fun place to hang out with this type of crowd, and can even make for a good place to have a date. I would recommend visiting here at least once.

name: Melanie Klinner
text: Always love going out to Lowe Mill to wander around the galleries and sometimes listen to music. All the gallery owners seem very passionate about their work and super friendly and ready to answer questions. My friend Aaryn just opened an art studio in 325, so stop by, check it out and say hello.

name: Morgann Peters
text: Lowe Mill is the best little gem in Huntsville. I have never felt more wonder and acceptance in such a place. People are encouraged to express all of their creativity here, and it's just one of the most amazing places to shop and meet people that I've ever been. I will return again and again.

name: John Restrepo
text: The inside is nice and the programs are good. The staff is knowledgeable but for a place that big, I think they might need 1 or 2 more staff members.

name: Christian Leach
text: One of the best places to go in Huntsville! They have a variety of shops and artist workspaces. There is a weekly artist market on the weekends filled with all sorts of neat stuff!

name: M Blevins
text: I follow Lowe on Instagram but had no idea the span of the place! I'm not sure I saw it all, as it was a bit overwhelming. Totally inspiring to see so many artists working hard in one building. What a great community and place to get local art!

name: Ja Behrend
text: Great shops and friendly people. The cigar box guitar shop was awesome and the knowledge staff were friendly, helpful, and informative. Great place!

name: Steve Ewing
text: Nice places

name: Merkyl999x
text:
Great complex that's always growing and changing.

Great art, great food, venues for events, music shows, STEM/STEAM businesses and events.

Great place to visit with the family on Saturday with an artist's market in the Flying Monkey area.  (Keep in mind that it's filled with private art studios, so if you're particular about what your family is exposed to, maybe scout it out first, but in general, the artists are very accepting of the fact that it's a rather public venue and keep their studio-fronts family-friendly.)

Lunch during the week is definitely an option, but keep in mind the main building doesn't get unlocked until 12.

You can still get access to some of the outside options, such as Happy Tummy and Pizzelle's since they aren't in the main complex.

name: Jalyn Kinsella
text: This was such a cool experience! Not a place you go to everyday. Lots of cool art and unique stores. Glad I stopped here while in the area. Definitely would recommend to any tourists. The kombucha bar was a really neat place and the kombucha was delicious!!! If you are in the area, highly recommend stopping here!

name: Quincia “Quin” The Queen
text: One of my favorite places!

name: Lana Heller
text: We went here for a Halloween thing my daughter is 3 and she looks loved. I also did. I've never been and would love to go again!!! 💖

name: Ashleigh
text: Awesome industrial building with great art studios/stores. Loved this place! Highly recommend.

name: John Harchanko
text: For this kind of place, the experience is what you make of it. Explore, shop, appreciate, talk to artists, listen to music, eat. For art, I like to start at the Huntsville Art League on the second floor to see what's new. They have a good sampling of the better artists. Summertime is always music on the docks. Cool place with always a surprise new artist exhibit around the corner.

name: Brooke Simmons
text: First time here and it was wonderful! The perfect saturday day date for my husband and I. We enjoyed some really good pizza Mountain Valley Pizzeria and walked around talking and admiring all the beautiful work.

name: Dawn Haga
text: So much cool places and things to do.  Kids love it as well as adults.  For all ages. Except toddlers,  they would b bored

name: Etta Lea
text: It’s so great to have such a great space and arts incubator here... a wonderful way to preserve Huntsville’s history while forging the way toward a culturally-rich future! I usually go to Lowe Mill for a comedy show, music or poetry at the Flying Monkey Theatre, but it’s also great to spend a few hours walking around to look at the arts, crafts and artists’ studios.

name: Absterdam
text: Lots of art studios that sell and provide artistic services!

name: Sara Hardin
text: My daughter is there this week with Hsv City Schools..Steam Works project!! We Love Lowe Mill!!

name: Howard Rochelle
text: Always a good environment. Friendly people, so many artists, and open doors all along tbe hallways. Great place to meet your local artists and get more involved.

name: Arthur Reynolds
text: Interesting place to browse for things of the arts and crafts category. Several classes on how to make things are held here too. The building is massive and easy to get lost in and around.

name: Wilton Brown
text: Fun place. Lots of cool arts and Huntsville flavor ;)

name: Morgan Bonner
text: Confusing layout but fun to navigate. If you're going, take someone who has been before. Great company, food, and art. Picture of Alchemy attached

name: Merkyl999x
text:
Great complex that's always growing and changing.

Great art, great food, venues for events, music shows, STEM/STEAM businesses and events.

Great place to visit with the family on Saturday with an artist's market in the Flying Monkey area.  (Keep in mind that it's filled with private art studios, so if you're particular about what your family is exposed to, maybe scout it out first, but in general, the artists are very accepting of the fact that it's a rather public venue and keep their studio-fronts family-friendly.)

Lunch during the week is definitely an option, but keep in mind the main building doesn't get unlocked until 12.

You can still get access to some of the outside options, such as Happy Tummy and Pizzelle's since they aren't in the main complex.

name: Molly Ruth Skiles
text: What a unique and entertaining experience! On the day we went there was a car boot sale, with all kinds of interesting things being offered. We had coffee tea, chocolates, saw stores offering art and art supplies of just about any sort one could imagine, and enjoyed exploring the many floors and areas of the facility. A truly magnificent, multi-sensory experience.

name: Ashleigh
text: Awesome industrial building with great art studios/stores. Loved this place! Highly recommend.

name: Etta Lea
text: It’s so great to have such a great space and arts incubator here... a wonderful way to preserve Huntsville’s history while forging the way toward a culturally-rich future! I usually go to Lowe Mill for a comedy show, music or poetry at the Flying Monkey Theatre, but it’s also great to spend a few hours walking around to look at the arts, crafts and artists’ studios.

name: Heather Brecht (BuG)
text: Wow..I never knew how much entertainment is local to me I need to get out more!!!

name: Ja Behrend
text: Great shops and friendly people. The cigar box guitar shop was awesome and the knowledge staff were friendly, helpful, and informative. Great place!

name: Lana Heller
text: We went here for a Halloween thing my daughter is 3 and she looks loved. I also did. I've never been and would love to go again!!! 💖

name: Heather Peavy
text: This is my favorite place in Huntsville. Ever since I moved to the area people told me to go to the Lowe Mill, you'll love the Lowe Mill. And they were not wrong. It's a melting pot of amazing artists and you can be just about anyone and fit in. I tell everyone about the Lowe Mill and the events that go on there. You won't find another place in town with such a high concentration of amazing people and art.

name: Jauhar Farid
text: You just can't beat good public art. Great atmosphere for the whole family. I'm definitely a fan!

name: Nick Roman (Roastt_Beef)
text: I went with some of my staff to Piper and Leaf whose tea was excellent! We also walked around Lowe Mill for some time just enjoying the aesthetic of it all. There was no specific order to the little shops I saw but they all look very Interesting. There was also a few indoor swing sets that were fully functional and could fit 2 people at once. There was also an arcade cabinet offering free plays of Mrs. Pacman and Galaga so we all had a great time!

name: Asher Berry
text: Cool place with huge diversity of studios and shops

name: Ashley Sullivan
text: Love. Love. Love. This is a favorite spot to visit. Piper and leaf always draws us in. Love everything about this place. Plenty to see and do. Ever changing offerings in the stores. And I always seem to find things I've never noticed before. The murals are amazing. The art is amazing. And the people are always fantastic. I tell everyone I can to visit. It is truly a hidden gem.

name: Daniel Whisenant
text: Great collection of local artist and members of Huntsville's community that gives an insight into the keep huntsville weird side of things.

name: Katelyn Miller
text: One of my favorite places in huntsville!! full of so much history and talented artists! the guitar shop inside is my brother's favorite place in the world. piper and leaf and all of the artists and Pizzelle's are my favorites!

name: Caleb Doerr
text: Service was fantastic and the Dracula crepe was crispy and fresh.

name: Aaron Spiegle
text: Really cool concept, vendors, and artists but kind of confusing to navigate and find the vendor you're looking for if you've never been there before.

name: Rich B
text: Really cool maker's space. A lot of creative energy in the building. This photo is metal sculptor Micah Gregg.

name: B E
text: I love this place! Lowe Mill is a great local place to see all of the amazing artisans that Huntsville has to offer! Check out their event page because they always have things going on!!

name: Glenda Lambert
text: One of my favorite places

name: Karen
text: We always enjoy this place. Fun to walk and browse and find something from a vendor.

name: Joe Staton
text: Three floors of artists.  Many different media available. Come walk through and find that special something you must take home.

name: Angela Simmons
text: It was nice. My Grandson went there for the week his program lasted. He enjoyed it. Thry made Robots. I enjoyed watching em battle on Friday. A real nice program

name: Molly Ruth Skiles
text: What a unique and entertaining experience! On the day we went there was a car boot sale, with all kinds of interesting things being offered. We had coffee tea, chocolates, saw stores offering art and art supplies of just about any sort one could imagine, and enjoyed exploring the many floors and areas of the facility. A truly magnificent, multi-sensory experience.

name: Ryan Kirk
text: Cool place. It was a bit hard to find things. They need more signs.

name: Amy Miller
text: I'm probably just too old for this place.  Everyone in Huntsville loves it, but I was not really impressed.  It is full of artists with their various wares as well as several thrift stores.  My college kids love thrifting.  I do not.  It is a wonderful concept to turn an old mill into various floors of arts and crafts rooms, but the floors are hard to navigate and it has various tripping hazards for older folks.  The only reason for the four stars is that there is a wonderful Kombucha bar - which is the main reason we went.  They craft their Kombucha on site and you can get what they have on tap for the day as well as a flight of each of the four daily choices.  This is worth the visit even if you aren't into crafts.  I should say that several of the shops were not open the day we went, so I could have missed the more unique and impressive artists - I do love art.

name: Candyse Crow
text: Awesome spot. Came for the concert on a Friday night, and got drawn in for the art. Fun location for family too. Amazing to see all of these talented people all in one convenient location.

name: Kreigan Hopkins (Antherian)
text: Lowe Mill is an awesome place to hang out, shops to eat and get something to drink. Amazing artists here that sell their work, from paint, chain mail, to crochet, they've got it here. I'd definitely recommend checking it out.

name: Clark L
text: Food, coffee, arts and artists in a cool repurposed venue--what's NOT to like?

name: Savannah Martin
text: Well the art, creativity and overall atmosphere was incredible. A perfect night out, just make sure you do not take the elevator. The women running it tonight was the rudest human I have ever encountered. The stairs are fabulously decorated though, so it should not be a problem.

name: Steph T
text: This has been a default comfort zone for me to go when I just want to walk around somewhere, or show someone somewhere interesting and have lots of cool things to look at and talk about! Lowe Mill has lots of family activities, as well. We just took my son to the Trick or Treat event a few weekends ago, and he thoroughly enjoyed himself! Also, lots of alternative types of art and locally made trinkets, food, just about anything you can think of. I'm more of an "alternative" type of person, so this place is always right up my alley.

name: Linda King
text: Still very empty. Might be real nice when the shops open back up.

name: Le Shan Wallace
text: R&B Vibes was awesome today

name: Michael Prosper
text: Laid back place to enjoy and buy local art

name: Aaron Lovejoy
text: This place is awesome!  We were visiting Mastermind Minis.  Food, art...what more could you want?

name: Stephanie Britton
text: Love the diversity

name: David Wallner
text: Lowe Mill is awesome. Saw Funkmaster Seeds! Jam out. Earlier we were invited into the Tangled Strings, where outkast's producer was speaking.

name: Cody Gothart
text: We used their studio for our rehearsal dinner recently and the staff and venue were amazing! Great response time and easy to work with. Will definitely look at then first for future events.

name: Joshua Spradlin
text: Swing dance Thursdays in the Flying Monkey Arts theater are the bomb! Great fun and awesome experience for such a low price. ($5 students $10 general)

name: Floyd Mueller
text: So many talented artists in such an interesting environment. Delightful just to walk through, lots of history. The brickwork is amazing. The artistry is full spectrum.😉

name: Pamela King
text: Great vendors and food!

name: Aidan Crowe
text: A true Huntsville landmark. It's got everything you need. Bring the family, eat lunch, drink coffee, buy board games/comic books/t-shirts/support local artists. One of the favorite spots for young adults not super into the club life. My friends and I spend a lot of time at Piper & Leaf. They also have live events and classes. Perfect for tourists and locals alike!

name: Madelaine Nelson
text: Great collection of artists and vendors.

name: Jade Wilson
text: One of the best places in Huntsville! The perfect place for shopping local: coffee, tea, dinner, desserts, ceramics/pottery, glass art, paintings, new and vintage clothes, books, signs, craft supplies, game miniatures, bags, crystals, and so much more! Not to mention the entertainment options; there's something fantastic going on there all the time. I love Lowe Mill and highly recommend it!! Head over there during public hours and spend a few hours browsing!

name: Paul Talley
text: Great venues. Music, movies and comedy

name: Pete Layne
text:
This is a must-see in Huntsville! Each shop is unique and the artists are fantastic! Musicians, Artists, Classes, Food, I could go on and on.
Do not miss out on this unique shopping/entertainment experience!

name: Shelby Bell (MarchSnow315)
text: Comic con was a lot of fun and it has a lot of interesting shops and studios available all year long

name: John Avent
text: Lowe Mill Arts & Entertainment has many wonderful aspects. From the art to the food and the atmosphere. It's a great place to grab a coffee or treat and walk around and see local artists and their work. Lowe Mill also has many different, fun filled events throughout the year. Lowe Mill has a great environment and is a good place to relax and meet people. Overall, well worth experiencing.

name: Ads Crane
text: I love Lowe Mill! You won't find anywhere like it. There is a huge variety of artists and things to do inside. Get lunch here and walk around! They also frequently have events here. Free admission, unique arts and crafts and foodies. Entertainmentand lots to see and do. Easy place to talk to strangers and friday nights I suggest lawn chairs, bring the kids and dogs too, one of our cities best dependable values. The music changes weekly and I have never had a bad time or experience there. I would highly recommend a visit!!

name: Lee Ellenburg
text: The go to place for all things arts in HSV. Good food, good music and awesome visual artists!

name: Yvo Gar
text: One of my favorite places to go to in Huntsville. You never know what you will find.

name: DGS DGS
text: Different than usual, better than mall and super centers, I removed one star because it is not easy to locate booths and shops.

name: Susan Weaver Koontz
text: Massive arts-related facility!  You will find artists of all kinds.  Great facility with lots of variety for creative venues.  Restaurants and specialty shops are great!

name: Zane Stewart
text: It's great, they have a bunch of cute art shops and my favorite thing is definately the indoor swings. Great place to stop by on a date or with the family.

name: Cami Ogden
text: Fun place to go to. Some of the shops seem to be a little more expensive than I prefer but I'm sure renting the space is what drives the prices up. Also, I have really loved going to the flying monkey to seeing dance every so often. I'd guess that most the people there are college students but I appreciate that it is open to anyone older as well. They usually have a nice crowd show up too.

name: Joshua Shelledy
text: Great idea for a centralised art collective. Lots of great artists seem to be able to thrive here.

name: Tim Williams
text: Love the crafts and the art but, I don't much care the politics of the place

name: Brandy
text: So much fun to walk around. Great for any age. Most artists have wonderful prices

name: Ryan Kirk
text: Cool place. It was a bit hard to find things. They need more signs.

name: Aaron Spiegle
text: Really cool concept, vendors, and artists but kind of confusing to navigate and find the vendor you're looking for if you've never been there before.

name: Tim Richey
text: Great place. Lots of Art and misc also small restaurants specialty teas in a quart jars. A couple of swings to enjoy. Nice place and enjoyable. Oh there's an freight elevator an the operator takes tips it is free though

name: Ashley Evans
text: I had a great time here. It’s a nice big area so, even though a lot of people are there, you don’t feel cramped. The food options are great but you will have a bit of a wait depending on which place you choose to eat. I really enjoyed going to a concert here, though. I will definitely return!

name: Joshua Spradlin
text: Swing dance Thursdays in the Flying Monkey Arts theater are the bomb! Great fun and awesome experience for such a low price. ($5 students $10 general)

name: Susan Weaver Koontz
text: Massive arts-related facility!  You will find artists of all kinds.  Great facility with lots of variety for creative venues.  Restaurants and specialty shops are great!

name: Caleb Doerr
text: Service was fantastic and the Dracula crepe was crispy and fresh.

name: DGS DGS
text: Different than usual, better than mall and super centers, I removed one star because it is not easy to locate booths and shops.

name: Zane Stewart
text: It's great, they have a bunch of cute art shops and my favorite thing is definately the indoor swings. Great place to stop by on a date or with the family.

name: Le Shan Wallace
text: R&B Vibes was awesome today

name: Hagan Fulmer
text: The tea and coffee are wonderful here, and the service is enjoyable. I love to get the summer time latte, and I couldn't get enough! Enjoy drinking fantastic drinks in a cozy atmosphere!

name: Sandra Pecora
text: So many trendy stores. Love seeing it again and again.

name: Serena Graham
text: Went there for a Saturday morning Zumba class it was AWESOME!

name: jess zeller
text: Always something interesting going on and many beautiful things to gaze at

name: LaRue Wisener
text:
It’s one of the most varied and interesting places you’ll go to, they have so much to look at and do.

Every local should visit here at least once.

The Halloween trick or treat I take my kids to every year, totally free.

name: Tim Palmer
text: This place really had it going on. I feel very comfortable in here. It's spacious and has tons of artsy stores, all accessible from the inside. There are places that sell art, crafts, books, clothing, and lots more. There is a cafe and Piper & Leaf tea had a place, too. Tangled Strings studio is in the premises, employing a luthier and having a performance stage. They occasionally have a concert outside on the outside docks that is well attended. Great place to spend a couple of hours (or more), just browsing or buying unique gifts.

name: timothy elliott
text: Wonderful place to some incredible art !

name: Greg Spruell
text: Always something interesting or entertaining happening. A good place to explore.

name: April Mathews
text: This place is amazing! There is something for everyone to enjoy.  From art installations to the record shop,  to interactive fiber arts,  to a real live think tank for kids you can find anything and everything going on at Lowe Mill. There's a great new coffee shop with a cool ambiance.  A spirits distillery and every facet of the art world is represented in beautiful color,  sound,  scent,  and taste.  Don't miss out on this local treasure.

name: christian hunsberger
text: An amazing place, great coffee, beautiful art. Great concerts and alot of fun times at low mill. I love coming here and relaxing with friends. One if my favorite places to go.

name: Barbara Swader
text: Vast art work available. 3 floors to see. Old time elevator service. Enjoyed visit. Would go back. Vendors friendly. Several food options.

name: Maya
text: A creative haven in the heart of Huntsville- a free to roam, art filled paradise with unlimited activities to engage in and artistic works to admire!  Lowe Mill is home to countless resident artists, music stores, a brewery, cafes, restaurants and even vegan cuisine, piper and leaf tea, vintage records, clothing, classes and week long activity nights including swing dancing, flea markets, concerts on the dock, conventions, art classes, free guitar lessons on Saturdays and of course their ever popular slam poetry night! Its a fabulous way to spend the day, go on a date, or catch up with friends.

name: Kate Blackwood
text: Awesome vendors and selection. Pizelle's chocolates are a must stop everytime

name: StrikerJ
text: They've definitely had the vibe of selling out over the last 7 years. They should definitely ban people bringing whole outdoor setups to the summer concerts as it leaves barely any room for others, or at least make them set up in the back. If you only a blanket you better get there two hours early or you won't see anything over the plague of old people sitting in chairs as close as possible to the stage.

name: Alan Hovexak
text: Fun place. Interesting things to see.

name: Debra Tufford
text: This solace is super groovy. I will definitely go back.

name: Denise Marsh
text: Spectacular history tied into Lowe Mill. Each place we visited had friendly, helpful employees.

name: Luke Emerson
text: Lowe Mill is a fantastic destination with many public events for the family. Some of my favorite shops are located here, including Piper and leaf tea. The range of artist is wide and the flying monkey theater has great shows.

name: TRACEY SWANN
text: AWESOME EVENT BIG ROOOM EVERYONE ACCOMMODATE GREAT FOOD& ENTERTAINMENT. LOTS OF LIGHTS

name: Jennifer Cobb
text: It is a fantastic family place. A lot of really cool art exhibits and hands on experiences. Bring the kids and the dogs

name: lynn otwell
text: We had a wonderful time. Very unique experience. We will visit again the next time we travel to Huntsville, Alabama

name: Natasha Groden
text: An amazing location filled with creative energy and artist. My family had a fantastic time walking through all the shops and experiencing what they had to offer.

name: Art League President
text:
There is no place like Lowe Mill.  Surely no one can come to Huntsville without visiting this unique and fun place.

The art is amazing.  Plus there are restaurants and entertainment options here.

name: laurie wright
text: So many shops to look in and enjoy. Great restaurants. Fancy items, whimsical items, practical items so in a historical place. My favorite is Inside Out art studio! It provides jobs for people with different abilities who are very talented artists!

name: Jody Birdy
text: Lowe Mill is a must see for anyone who is an art enthusiast. The concept is amazing. After visiting several times I've noticed that many of the studios appear to be locked up with no artists in sight, even on a Saturday when most people are able to spend time enjoying the art. Thus, it lacked the bustling art community/marketplace feel that you would expect visiting such a large fine arts venue. Where are the artists? That however is not the fault of Lowe Mill. It's the fault of the artists who must not be starving, lol. The atmosphere doesn't feel friendly, even the woman sitting in the office is unapproachable. Why do people think art and snobbery are interchangeable? Anyway, the main reason I gave it only 4 stars is because the stairwell in the Flying Monkey had such a bad urine smell. It's extremely off putting and screamed trashy for that section of the mill. My 10 year old asked what the smell was. We should have gone to the elevator so that I didn't have to explain why people pee in stairwells.

name: Lindsey Johnston
text: I really enjoyed my visit to Lowe Mill. There were tons of different studio spaces with plenty to offer. There is even a bar and distillery! Lowe Mill also has a few little restaurants within it's walls along with a cute Piper and Leaf tea shop. I would definitely recommend.

name: white white
text: This place is full of Different cultures of talented people. Loved the Fling Monkey!

name: Rachel Haggard
text: Love this place, wish they had this up North

name: DogBar Dave
text: Fun place to visit & check out local artists' wares.

name: Jessica Thompson
text: I like shopping at Lowe Mill. It would be super helpful if there were more maps of all the shops/spaces, though. Posted, like, everywhere. If you don't go a lot, it can be confusing. I love all the options for local gifts! Dog friendly!

name: Live Concerts
text: Really cool and artsy place. If you can figure out where the entrance is, you'll have a good time.

name: Mark Jessing
text: Great place to go to buy art or meet other artists. Cool use of an ols textiles manufacturing building.

name: Kelsey T
text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! So funky and so much to look at. I could walk around this place for hours. Will definitely be back!

name: AJ Taylor
text: Contemporary arts center where local artists and eclectics can gather to trade, barter, and sell their products in an organized fashion befitting the setting and atmosphere. Many creative spaces and talents housed inside of an old factory building near downtown Huntsville. Restuarants are also here if you happen to get hungry while browsing the masterpieces hidden away inside! Stop in, grab a handmade greeting card, a stained glass piece, some pottery, and don't forget to grab a chocolate on your way out! This location is one of the many reasons to love Hunstville, and North Alabama!

name: Greg Richardson
text: Great shops and good places to eat. Love Vertical House Records. Happy Tummy is great place to eat and Pizzele's has the best homemade truffles

name: Roy Brown
text: Wide variety of artisans, food and drink. Great place to walk around and see the sights. They have numerous events, from live music, to dance classes and more.

name: Japheth Jones
text: great indoor version of a flea market that's more really a craft fair or artist co-op. Love everything except the layout is a bit sprawling and they could do with better signage inside and out.

name: Stacey
text: Wonderful place to browse for inspiration. Also a great place to find unique gifts for anyone. Gifts that will support local and handmade.

name: Ramon Asmad
text: I loved this place...as simple as that

name: MomiJuana Brat
text: It was closed, but really nice on outside with shaded seating AND a FANTASTIC food truck.

name: Janet Morris
text: I love going to Lowe Mill, but accessibility is a bit of a struggle. There's one elevator and it has to be operated by someone who works there. The elevator operator is only human and needs breaks, so sometimes there's a delay getting an artist or business employee/owner to come run it in his place. Also, you have to walk halfway across the Mill to get to that elevator from the handicap accessible parking & entrances.

name: shilo woods
text: Always fun to go to lowe mill the vendors are always so nice and sell very unique items lowe mill also has the best chocolate store in Huntsville 🤤💕

name: Adam “Oldman” Martin
text: Brilliant concept. I love everything about this place.

name: Jeffery Mathis
text:
Went to Huntsville Comic Convention! Had a blast! Can't wait to do it again.

P.S. The old school elevator is awesome!

name: Samuel Kawell
text: Lowe Mill is an excellent place if you are into quirky art in an antiquey environment. The building is very large and is the home of numerous and varied artists. Additionally, there are several places to eat and free parking. It is not in the best part of town, but you feel safe in both the parking lot and the building.

name: Anonymous Reviewer
text: Cool unique area with food art classes and more

name: Nancy Turner
text: Nice place to go look around..today was my first time going

name: John Stanners
text: A place for great food and even better art.

name: Donna Davis
text: That place are always some new stuff and provide new idea

name: Phillip Perry
text: Awesome place to explore. Lots of neat shops and stores and restaurants. One could spend several hours exploring and hanging out.

name: Bree k
text:
The best place in Huntsville for family arts and fun.
A whole lot to see and some of the best Southern Tea can be found here as well!!
I suggest checking in often, as events not worth missing and classes are updated often.
See you there

name: Jen Britt
text: Mountain Valley Pizzeria is hands down the best pizza & homemade bread out there!!

name: James Wyatt
text: Fantastic to see the artist / maker community active. Can't wait to take classes there.

name: Julia Walters
text: I've been visiting Lowe Mill for a couple of years now.  I've enjoyed every visit and everyone I've met has been welcoming and friendly. The volunteers are amazing and never stop!!  The artists are so varied that there is entertainment around every corner.  There's a place for everyone at Lowe Mill and I will continue to attend the concerts, the Flying Monkey venues and Happy Tummy (yum!)!!  I'm looking forward to the fall concerts!!  Love Lowe Mill!!!

name: Shawn
text: I love the atmosphere at Lowe Mill!  The artists are so nice and informative about their different crafts.  I can spend a whole day there getting lost in beads and conversation!

name: J Kemeny
text: Fun and funky art and jewelry.  Plus, great food and desserts ♥️

name: Courtney Brown
text: Such a great space in Huntsville. So many neat things going on here, from food, music, whiskey, bikes, there's something for everyone. Cool place to hang out, great some lunch or coffee, and walk around. Also look for the concerts on the dock.

name: Kelli T
text: Great place to explore the arts, enjoy some food, and escape the hustle and bustle

name: Deborah Dudley
text: Will visit again. Well worth another visit.

name: Pokeypuppy 105
text: Great place to view and buy artwork! Piper leaf tea company has some great teas. Once a shoe factory Lowe mill houses many artist studios, some restaurants, a record shop, and stands as a great venue for events.

name: Aeriel Michelle
text: Always fun, funky, artsy and entertaining! The best place in Huntsville to find your next favorite thing or take a class, find a new hobby (or indulge an old one like wine and painting!), or grab a bite/drink.

name: GNUFEED
text: Not bad, kind of like a flea market that took over a warehouse. I went there ultimately for vertical house records which was slick. They had decent selection (albeit you can tell he gets picked a lot) and prices were really solid. Being used to paying a premium for good quality used vinyl this place was refreshing. Picked up some great southern blues stuff which is not common where i'm at. They do also participate in RSD case you are looking for a shop that does that. Friendly staff, busy with customers. Will make a point to come back to this shop.

name: Shanai Moore
text: Went for the couple's pottery class and enjoyed it! Not expensive, and worth the money spent!

name: Ellen George
text: There are so many incredibly talented artists here, it's mind-blowing! Even if you aren't an art enthusiast be sure to check out the popsicle shop on the top floor. They're DELICIOUS and super affordable! My only complaint is that the stairwells smell like pee.

name: Michael Wert
text: You have to stop in and try the pizza at Mountain Valley Pizza and Bakery. It's amazingly delicious! And the staff is kind and generous too! We will be back!

name: Anita McCormick
text: Really nice laid back place to shop or eat.

name: Janesa Terry
text: Always changing. Always something new and cool to look at 🥰

name: Beth Guthrie
text: So many talented artists and vendors! You can find anything from unique jewelry and clothing to antique books and lithographic prints. Potters, painters, and artists galore make the Mill is one of my favorite places to spend time on my own or with friends.

name: waller king
text: This place is the heart of the art scene in Huntsville, from hand blown glass to wood work they have it all. On the weekends theyhave concerts on the docks where great local bands play fun for the whole family! Dont forget The Flying Monkey wherelocal artists also play in one of there lofts and you can bring your own alcohol if your 21 or over. Also their food court is awesome the crepe place is amazing I always get the gyro crepe and one of the jars of tea from the tea place, they also have Chef Will's vegan food truck that is to die for.  This olace is one of Huntsvilles gems like Bandito Burrito and Big Spring Cafe!

name: Michel Alexander
text: Fantastic artist market! Lots of nifty things to see, and most of the artists were super friendly, willing to really talk about their work and techniques. Lots of kid activities, many free: drawing/painting workshops, cigar-box guitar lessons, hula-hooping lessons (for all ages, & quite fab!), etc. If you're into vinyl, there's a great record store. The artisan chocolate place is incredible, with good coffee, too.

name: Johnny Franklin
text: Lots of artists that have set up shop in an old cotton mill.    Cool vibe and a very good pizza shop also

name: Malko Vexsur
text: Great place with a lot of great shops just wish they had air conditioning

name: Deacon Wolfwood
text: Absolutely the most artists under 1 roof. So amazing. Spent the better part of 2 days here and there is still more to see! 10/10 will visit again

name: Traci Fritz
text: Great place to walk around and see art and get some unique food (snacks, tea, coffee, chocolates,etc.

name: David Sparks
text: Popsicles! Art! Cool T-shirts! And more.

name: Paul Mandrell
text:
Lowe Mill is always a really fun place to visit!
My kids love Suzy’s popsicles. My wife loves Piper and leaf tea.

name: Brenna Terry
text: LOVE Lowe Mill! Endless galleries and artists. Houses dining as well. Check out Happy Tummy and Pizelle's Confections for a meal and a treat. Try Suzy's Pops on a hot day! Parking is plentiful. The artists often have an "open door" policy and are very friendly, happy to show you their projects. There are always special events such as Concerts on the Dock or the Winter Solstice Marketplace.

name: Ariel McDougal
text: I love this place! It has been growing better and bigger each year and has wonderful shops and artistry

name: Bri Chivatero
text: This is one of my favorite places in Huntsville. There are dozens of working artists who use all kinds of mediums -- woodworking, glass, crochet, comic books, paintings... and there are a ton of classes. I'm planning on taking some crocheting classes in the fall when I return to Huntsville. They do a bunch of events, too. There's swing dancing every Thursday night, and special events periodically.

name: Joseph Blackman
text: Love the atmosphere and art. So many good things to say about this place

name: Patricia Bondor
text: If you love anything to do with art then this will be your happy place!!!

name: Tom Frazier
text: Eclectic shops and arts. Great food truck (can't remember the name though). Often has events and music. Really fun and interesting place to shop or just walk around!

name: Spencer Stantis
text: This place was really cool and completely unexpected. Part of a companies agreement to open up here is that you must be accessible to the public. So, we were able to just walk into the archeology offices and got a tour. The art here ranges from classic to bizarre to amazing, and sometimes all three! Don't forget to pick up a tea to enjoy on you walk through the complex.

name: Listiel Rock
text: Easy to reach. Excellent facilities for events like book signing and product launches.

name: Samuel Beal
text: Lots of fun things to do...I would recommend this to any of my friends.

name: Gnomish Lord
text: I very wonderful place with lots of shops & things to explore!

name: Zack Henry
text: A true "huntsville experience". On every list of things to do in Huntsville, and for good reason. A truly unique (at least in this area) artist complex. Great artist displays and shops, and innovative food concepts. If you live in Huntsville and have never been, fix that now! 😀

name: Pat Reynolds
text: Now..this is one funky place!  Just wandered in and out of businesses.  Lots of artists, Weaver's, printers.  Lots of talent.  Whatever you are looking for in arts, you may find here.  Sorta like a huge, flea market.

name: Amanda Murphy
text:
This is one of our favorite places in Huntsville. While living here, my husband and I had a Friday tradition of stopping by Lowe Mill after work and some of our fondest memories are here. Some of our favorite shops are Suzy's, Piper and Leaf, Pizelle's, and Happy Tummy. (We didn't get to visit Alchemy or the distillery very often because I was pregnant for the majority of our time here.)

For anyone living here, I would recommend taking advantage of the Concerts on the Dock, swing dance lessons, art lessons, and themed parties. I wish we had done more than we did! Check the website--there was more going on here than I first knew!

For visitors or first timers, I would recommend visiting on a Saturday mid-morning or Friday evening--there are often events going on during these times so you'll get the best experience. Take your time walking around to view the art and vendors--there are so many talented people and great things you will find there.

This is a great place to bring guests or visitors--we brought all our friends and family and they were all surprised and delighted by what they found. I'd say this is my top recommendation for anyone visiting the area.

name: Stephen
text: Love this place. Some very talented artist. Make sure to check out the cigar box guitar guy.

name: Thomas White
text: I like the art and the shops are nice to look at. Plus Piper & Leaf tea is good.

name: Igor Maslovaric
text: Good venue. Great food trucks.

name: S Carmack
text: Winter Market was great. What would this town do without Lowe Mill?

name: Christopher Cornelius
text: Mix of artists of all types, some shops, and some food and beverages..it's a great place to spend an afternoon for sure.

name: Julio Cruz
text: Unique arts museum that keeps finding innovate ways to cater to it's community.

name: Anshul Godha
text: Excellent location to spend an afternoon. Makes us feel proud about the arts and crafts scene from Huntsville. Highly recommend striking conversations with the artists.

name: Damia Falconbury
text: Beautiful building with great murals on several entrances. Several choices for great food. Of course a huge array of artists,

name: Anna Brooks
text: Lowe Mill is one of the (if not THE) artsiest places in Huntsville. It is a great place for a date, afternoon out with friends, or a family stroll. Be sure to check the hours before planning a visit.

name: Brian Cantley
text: I love Lowe mill cool shops fun events!

name: Laura Schoen
text: Definitely visit this place. Great place to wander around for hours for free. Great place to see art and get great food. Great place to buy art and see entertainment. It's a great  date place!

name: D'Angelo Portis
text: This place is an absolute treat to visit, and a great place for supporting local artists. I love going here and plan to continue coming.

name: Mark Stevenson
text: Great place...always something new.

name: charlie smitherman
text: Interested in arts and other creative things?vist the mill! lots of creative shops and friendly people. I personaly recommend the cigar box guitars shope they have free lessons every Saturday 12pm to 2pm.

name: Robert Greene
text: Retro-Fitt gave our daughter the perfect outfit.

name: Hunter Vroonland
text: Favorite place in Huntsville. Great place to get some food and see art work !

name: Snezhana Tuttle
text: Neat place. Love going here often to enjoy great art.

name: Jess McClellan
text: I absolutely love going to Lowe Mill! Great atmosphere! Very welcoming and warm.  I have yet to have a bad time at Lowe Mill.  It is very laid back and you can go to have a great lunch at Happy Tummy (Fred bread! delish!)  and stroll around to see the local art. I have also had the pleasure of enjoying the free concerts on the docks.  The community garden is great, too!  Fantastic time all around!

name: Timothy Murphy
text: Expansive

name: Katherine Garayanala
text: Just everything artsy in one place!!! Definitely will go again

name: Edward Troupe
text: Was fun to stroll through the old plant and see how it has been repurposed :)

name: Johnny Franklin
text: Lots of artists that have set up shop in an old cotton mill.    Cool vibe and a very good pizza shop also

name: Lillian Wells
text: Great! Always clean, and good food. Any complaints are quickly dealt with. Staff is always friendly.

name: Malko Vexsur
text: Great place with a lot of great shops just wish they had air conditioning

name: Allen Davis
text:
I recently stopped by for the first time. I visited many of the shops and was well received at each shop. The owners were very gracious and many even stopped and showed me how they performed their magic. I didn't get to see even half of the artist and their crafts. I spent many enjoyable hours looking at the many interesting items.

I will be back and plan to bring my friends.

Allen

name: Ariel McDougal
text: I love this place! It has been growing better and bigger each year and has wonderful shops and artistry

name: theresa B
text: This is a very cool spot filled with so much unique artwork, food and gifts. The only issue is figuring out when each individual shop will be open. I brought my mom and aunt here on a Friday afternoon (around 1) and most of the vendors were not there even though their signs said they opened at 10 or 11 or 12 on Fridays. So don't expect to get to see everything when you are there. Most of the second floor was closed that day. I would have thought Friday would be a sure deal that most stores would be open which is why I picked that day to go.

name: Joseph Blackman
text: Love the atmosphere and art. So many good things to say about this place

name: Julio Cruz
text: Unique arts museum that keeps finding innovate ways to cater to it's community.

name: Thomas White
text: I like the art and the shops are nice to look at. Plus Piper & Leaf tea is good.

name: Listiel Rock
text: Easy to reach. Excellent facilities for events like book signing and product launches.

name: Aubrey Watts
text: Super fun place to hang out, walk around, and grab a bite to eat. Always something interesting going on.

name: Julie Piskin
text: Great place to go alone, with friends, with family, or even with a date. There's tons to see and do. My husband and I had a great time and we didn't spend a dime (this time).

name: Mark Mohon
text: Hundreds of artists from emerging to long careers; visual to performing; wild-child to button down. Open studios, concerts, classes, and large events. Food if you are hungry. One of THE best things to do in Huntsville.

name: MrSupr3me
text: One of the best places to eat i recommend chef wills. Its a food truck

name: Michele Keepers
text: What an amazing place to visit. Largest private collect of art along with my favorite coffee house, popsicle maker, oh my gosh the crepes, the fabulous tea, and I could go on and on. Anytime my kids want to go to Hsv STEAM Works, I am happy to take them. Wonderful place to take visitors, or escape the outside. Nice touch of history, and fantastic artists everywhere you turn. Thank you to the man that made this happen!

name: John Fishman
text: Incredibly great venue in Huntsville for arts and entertainment. Needs a late night pub.

name: Blanca Gonzalez
text: It's an awesome place with many exhibits and artists.

name: The Trainmobile
text: Great place to look around and take pictures. Can get disorienting inside, but they do have maps. Also, not all the restrooms in the building have adequate space, so I recommend going before you get here. Amazing place if you like the arts.

name: Deidra Carter
text: Always a good place to visit with friends/family. STEAMworks is awesome!

name: Jana Russell Nails
text: Excellent entertainment theater, loads of cool craft booths, in a historic landmark building big enough to lose yourself in.

name: Bryan Williams
text: Awesome atmosphere,  terrific artists, and just a beautiful facility.

name: Greg Mccarty
text: Alot of the stores were not open

name: Grezlin 1
text: The history of the building combined with the plethora of artists there give the place a great atmosphere. It's an extremely fun place to go filled with a lot of artistic talent and several unique places to shop and things to do. Lowe Mill is good for people of all ages to explore Huntsville's creativity or make a friend at one of the many Concerts on the Dock.

name: Tameka Davis
text: Ecclectic - if you are into the arts this is the ideal place to go.

name: Sherrie Dunn
text: This is a pretty cool place to hang out on the weekends.  I love the concerts on the dock. I also enjoy strolling around to see all the artists work on display.  Piper and Leaf is always on my agenda as well.

name: Brian Washington
text: Ok.  Hipster/Hippie sort of place.  A few interesting studio artists.

name: Chase Dyer
text: Hit-or-miss. Depends on the art. Good atmosphere, but an occaisional bout of overreaching artists peddling mediocre tchotchke stuff to tourists at what WOULD be metropolitan prices.

name: Neal Grillo
text: Huntsville's most unique destination. This is the sort of place that really puts life and vibrance into the city. No corporations, just makers doing what they love. Very visitor friendly.

name: Michael Carroll
text:
An island of creativity and "weirdness" in Huntsville.

In addition to the artists, be sure to check out the Concerts on the Dock series every Friday in the spring and fall.  It's a great to bring a blanket, the kids, and the dog and unwind at the end of the work week.

We also enjoy the monthly Epic Comedy Hour that takes place in the Flying Monkey Theater on the second floor.

name: Keith Jackson
text: Fun place to walk around on the weekends. There are dozens of artists with various skills. Most of them sell items or host classes.  The layout isn't the most organized, but there are maps everywhere.

name: theresa B
text: This is a very cool spot filled with so much unique artwork, food and gifts. The only issue is figuring out when each individual shop will be open. I brought my mom and aunt here on a Friday afternoon (around 1) and most of the vendors were not there even though their signs said they opened at 10 or 11 or 12 on Fridays. So don't expect to get to see everything when you are there. Most of the second floor was closed that day. I would have thought Friday would be a sure deal that most stores would be open which is why I picked that day to go.

name: Rebecca Schroeder
text: This place is just beautiful and so fun to walk and look at what's all going on.  I wish the artist market had more folks selling goodies.  But I think I think we visited on a Saturday that most vendors were at another big craft festival.

name: Carole Schaffer
text: It's a hidden jem. I really enjoyed  the little independent  shops.  It inspired  me with the ideas and creativeness  of one's mind. It's a great place to visit and to support the artists.

name: Jewel Smith
text: If you come to Huntsville, you must visit Lowe Mill, especially if you're an art lover. There's no other place like it that I've seen. This is a place where you can appreciate art, interact with art, and buy art. There's also great little shops and food inside such as a vintage store, a coffee and tea shop, and an artisan chocolate shop. If you're looking for a center of culture in Huntsville, Lowe Mill is it.

name: Victoria Gray
text: Wow,  several floors with around 150 artists. Cafes and a tasting room,  we bought some amazing hand made chocolates.  Classes available at lots of the individual gallery /workshops.

name: Blake Hargrove
text: The community is wonderful. Many of the events they have are family friendly. The different businesses and artists within the mill are diverse, extremely friendly, and a delight to experience. Highly recommend a visit to see the talented people within our community!

name: Sunny G
text: Amazing creative space in the middle of Huntsville. Variety of arts for everyone. Some classes. A great record store. Delicious truffle shop. This is one of my favourite places in HSV.

name: David Seligson
text: Enjoyed getting a tea at Piper and walking through the 3 floors of artist's work shops/offices.

name: Greg Reynolds
text: A different but fun and interesting experience. Easily accessible.

name: Stephen Bryant
text: Very cool artsy place, has a little of everything

name: Lori Lester
text: Lowe Mill is fabulous!  What a sensational use of a beautiful, historic old building.  The Grumpy Cat Art Project was so much fun, and I hope to see more like it.  A wonderful way to spend a Saturday, wandering through the halls enjoying the art, food and entertainment!  I hope to see Lowe Mill get even bigger and better!

name: Morgan Bonner
text: Confusing layout but fun to navigate. If you're going, take someone who has been before. Great company, food, and art. Picture of Alchemy attached

name: Allen Davis
text:
I recently stopped by for the first time. I visited many of the shops and was well received at each shop. The owners were very gracious and many even stopped and showed me how they performed their magic. I didn't get to see even half of the artist and their crafts. I spent many enjoyable hours looking at the many interesting items.

I will be back and plan to bring my friends.

Allen

name: Everyman Dan
text: Always love getting a Piper and Leaf Tea and  walking around all the booths and looking at the amazing work, talking to the artists, and sometimes buying a new piece for me or someone I know.  They have a few places to eat also with happy tummy and usually 1 or more food trucks outside. Also try pizelles for some delicious freshly made one of a kind chocolates. The staff is very friendly and can help you pick one you'll love.  They always have free event from concerts on the docks to kids day with tons of bouncy houses and nerf wars. Just a great place to visit and bring the family!

name: Rebecca Rideout
text: nice concept but confusing space to navigate. stairways smell of heavy urine, to the point smelling it almost makes you physically sick.

name: Bex Boggs
text: There's great food and desserts, they have tons of artists, you can catch great music and entertainment groups

name: Emerson Oliver
text: This is a really cool place to visit if you a couple of hours.  Grab some tea at piper and leaf and then go see the art and maybe how whiskey is made upstairs.  Kids love the popsicles.  also checkout the free Friday concerts.

name: Suezy Proctor
text: What a great local attraction! There is literally something for everyone - classes, performances, working artist studios representing the gamut across the art spectrum. Food and beveraged ample parking, handicap accessible.

name: PulseBeatz22
text: Its a cool hangout spot especially if you like art and cool cadet an food. Pkus piper and leaf is there an they have awesome tea! An I'm not much of a tea person

name: Chrissyart creations
text: Sold my necklace here! Going next week end

name: Ray Toth
text: Great place to visit when you have time to just walk and enjoy great art, food, and music.  We go here often and always enjoy talking and visiting with the purveyors of the various shops.  Great for Friday music on the dock in the summer also.

name: Timothy Pruitt
text: Awesome!

name: Mark Maclin
text: I live right next door to Lowe Mill in the summertime I could sit on my porch and listen to the live bands and I know for true fact that some of those bands are awesome.

name: Jamie Moon
text: Quite a unique place. Lots of cool random shops with interesting local art. Easy to get lost so plan to spend some time here. Only regret is it is only open on weekends and shopowners have unpredictable hours. Check out the record store and the tea shop if you go. I definitely plan to come back soon.

name: Jody Thomas
text:
Trailhead carries Kona and Specialized. The staff is amazing and they have great expert mechanics. Good vibes all
Around.

name: chaithanya kompella
text: Amazing art and inspiring artists !

name: Shelly Williams
text: Many artists and art to see. Truly enjoyed the food at Chief Will.

name: James Truffa
text: Good place to shop

name: Liz Hardy
text: So many fun local vendors and they had a dance event in the theater space when I was there. Dogs are allowed upstairs! Best thing ever!

name: Jamie Jordan
text: You can find something for everyone. Love all the local art! The coffee and chocolate shops are a must

name: Ira Sivley
text: Went for the comic expo and had a great time

name: James
text:
Great place for Music, Arts, and Entertainment. Every Saturday they have their arts market which is always interesting to go to. Throughout the week they have a combination of classes, dances, art performance, etc... So never a dull moment.

Lowe Mill is the largest independently owned arts facility in the US so go out and support these guys and gals.

name: Steve Crandall
text: We were there on a Thursday afternoon, but were really disappointed that many of the shops weren't open and that, for first timers, the corridor maps to what is open were really hard to understand. Felt they need more signing to ensure you are on the right track and not spending all your time wondering if you should be where you are, or if anything will be there when you finally make it to your destination.

name: tia moore
text: Great place, historical building that has various arts, crafts, music....A fun place to go... Calendar online and website let's u know when events are held plus classes. I highly recommend going.

name: Lora King
text: Wonderful variety of local businesses and artists. Lots of free concerts and local entertainment. Frequently hosts family/kid events. Very welcoming community. Happy Tummy is delish, but come early to avoid a line!

name: George Preussel
text: An artist community with all the trimmings.  You can find that special gift, treat, or just have a wonderful afternoon or evening.  Special events here all the time.  Make sure you stop by Happy Tummy and Mastermind Models!

name: Gil Ruiz
text: Painters, sculptors, jewelers, printmakers, craftsmen and artists of all types can be found in this eclectic home of creativity and fun. Frequent events, food, and coffee makes it an excellent place to visit.

name: Patrick Nesbit
text: Lots of great shops, I especially liked the Cigar Box Guitar Shop as well as Ms Guadalupe's Pottery Shop. Very high quality items in both of those shops!  Fun place!

name: Christopher Denenny
text: This place just goes on and on. If you’re into art you might need more than just a day to see all the vendors

name: Dennis Liuzzo
text: The flying monkey comedy club is great we love this place. So cool. Great music outside in summer

name: Andrew Ward
text: Great trunk or treat for Halloween every year

name: Scott Seeley
text: Unique property. A great way to spend a Saturday afternoon. Hours are limited so check their Google local listing.

name: destiny melgar
text: Great place! The Flying Monkeys arts center is the best part!

name: Becca M
text: No other experience out there. In the summer we love coming to the farmers market. If we're in the mood for real artisan coffee, there's a beautiful coffee cafe hidden up stairs. When it's to hot outside, we go to the hand crafted popsicle shop where they have amazing flavors you didn't think could be on a stick! I got Horchata and it was exactly like the beverage! There is so many artists who craft 100s of different things for show and sale. They also do workshops and classes for those interested in learning some trades.

name: David Crow
text: Cool place, clean with a very casual vibe.

name: Miriah Brink
text: A very fun find. Could spend hours exploring the place. Lots of art, cafes, and even a whiskey maker.

name: Sarah Fowler
text: A lovely all around place to visit,it has much to offer,you'll keep wanting to come back again and again,it's such an interesting place ,so many "treasures",surely something everyone will like!

name: Thelonious Jazzman
text: I love this place! Individual artists and craftsmen (craft persons? ☺) have their own studios. There are also coffee shops, eateries and specialties. A repurposed textile mill, it's a vast space with lots of artsy, weird (i.e., eclectic, eccentric) people, as one would expect.

name: Robert Jacobs (Andodaman)
text: Lowe Mills Blok Party 2017

name: Anna Kathryn Judd
text: First time at Concert on the Docks, listening to Solar Fleur. Super fun band and great way to spend a Friday evening! Will be back for more nights here!

name: Tamars monroe
text: Very entertaining always a pleasant surprise.

name: Diana Johnson
text: So many amazing things to see.... good food to eat !

name: Victoria Bailey
text: You can spend hours and hours here talking with local artists and connecting with people in the community! I visit Lowe Mill everytime I'm in AL and it's great to see the growth and improvements going on here! I'm looking forward to my next visit!

name: Dr. Timothy Cremeens
text: A unique place with creative, quirky shops.

name: Silvana Jenkins
text: Great place to shop, eat or have coffee. Just walk around, mingle and enjoy the local community. So many opportunities to learn crafts and see the local economy at work!!!

name: Michael Bradley
text: Always a nice environment. Pet friendly.

name: Brandi Cole
text: Great historic artist market.  Numerous events monthly. Concerts on the dock are great! Wonderful eateries!

name: Chris Wheeler
text: Great place.

name: marciefantasstic
text: I have frequented Lowe Mill for a while.  Over the years I have had the pleasure of getting involved with some of the wonderful things that happen there.  I now have friends and even family that keep studio spaces. I even recently got a job in a chocolate shop there.  It is such an amazing place.  So much is happening all the time.  Its a haven for people who appreciate creativity and want to express and share it.

name: Gavin Smith
text: Los of fun, interesting shops and galleries.   Most shopkeepers are happy to talk as you wander the refurbished mill.  Lots of entrainment and classes offered as well!  Check their calendar!

name: Bryan Watson
text: This is one of the coolest places in town, local arts, foods as well as shows in the theater. Happy tummy makes great sandwiches, and Chef Will makes amazing food and is always good to visit with. A saturday stroll through the mill is always rewarding.

name: Bruce Long
text: The art crap is weird and can go in a dumpster. The restaurants and the overall atmosphere won my heart. I spent a lot of time there. Tea downstairs and dancing upstairs... It's worth exploring (even if places aren't open).

name: Jenny
text: I'm not that big into local artists but it seems like a welcoming place

name: Michael Byrd
text: Old manufacturing Mill converted. Nice place to visit and look around. Arts and crafts vendors and eclectic atmosphere make for a fun time. And don't miss out on free concerts on the dock.

name: Angelique Lebron
text: Very unique and fun! Plenty of interesting things to do and cute little food spots to choose from!

name: David Story
text: By far one of the hidden treats of Huntsville.

name: Lee Messerli
text: Awesome venue for the arts.... Music,  theater,  and more. Don't miss the Spring and Fall free music concerts.  Catch a show in the theater section.  Visit all the various art vendors that are bound to have something to tickle your fancy.

name: Ashley Lowder
text: One of my favorite places in town! The concerts on the docks in the summer time are the best!!

name: Sheila Conlon (Teqbird)
text: Fabulous!!! Great repurposed facility!!! Lots of options.. Seemed to be mostly closed on Sundays but want to go back during peak hours to see the excitement.

name: Matthew Christopher
text: Nice place and big.. lots of artwork plus dog friendly..

name: destiny melgar
text: Great place! The Flying Monkeys arts center is the best part!

name: Gavin Smith
text: Los of fun, interesting shops and galleries.   Most shopkeepers are happy to talk as you wander the refurbished mill.  Lots of entrainment and classes offered as well!  Check their calendar!

name: Jim Bert
text: The quality of art work on display is improving dramatically.  To see the "best of the best", check out the "Across the Bridge" show @ the Carnegie Art Center in Decatur.  The show features works from 7 of Lowe Mill's best artists.  Open through 6/25/16.

name: Emily Pfeifer
text: Fun, exotic art market with coffee/tea, popsicles/chocolates and crepes . Offers live music and other fun activities through out the month. Enjoyed my visit here

name: Thelonious Jazzman
text: I love this place! Individual artists and craftsmen (craft persons? ☺) have their own studios. There are also coffee shops, eateries and specialties. A repurposed textile mill, it's a vast space with lots of artsy, weird (i.e., eclectic, eccentric) people, as one would expect.

name: Dave Jackman
text: Really neat to walk around and see artists doing their thing. Concerts on the docks are usually fun. Avoid the bronze working shop by the dock unless you're looking for bronze statues of naked women, which is pretty much all he does.

resp.text: Hi Dave! Thanks for stopping by. Everett is an extremely talented bronze artist who has worked in the field for years. The work that goes into the process is absolutely unreal. It takes months, sometimes and entire year, to finish one piece. He creates various works, some of which are in fact human figures. Did you know that he designed and cast the bronze trains for the City of Madison as well as the bronze ducks for the Lucky Duck Scavenger Hunt for the City of Huntsville? He is a very talented, hard-working artist, so please be a little bit more considerate.

name: Steve Crandall
text: We were there on a Thursday afternoon, but were really disappointed that many of the shops weren't open and that, for first timers, the corridor maps to what is open were really hard to understand. Felt they need more signing to ensure you are on the right track and not spending all your time wondering if you should be where you are, or if anything will be there when you finally make it to your destination.

name: Colin Quinn
text: Great place for conventions and art shows! I had a wonderful time while I was there!

name: Miriah Brink
text: A very fun find. Could spend hours exploring the place. Lots of art, cafes, and even a whiskey maker.

name: Genevieve Vigil
text: Crunchy, hipster, unusual, fun space. Great vendors and classes. A good dancing scene

name: Will
text: If you ever visit Huntsville this place should definitely be on your list. Art everywhere, Piper and Leaf, record store, tons of events, plenty to do on a short day trip.

name: Patti McKee
text:
When I have any out of town guests, Lowe Mill is the first place I take them to, since it is full of creative energy  and eclectic artists who have always gone out of their way to welcome us!  Huntsville is so lucky to have a place for artists whose specialties range from designing jewelry to custom cigar box guitars!

Lowe Mill is definitely my favorite place to go in North Alabama.

text: Lowe Mill is part of what makes Huntsville very culturally diverse, as it's a great melting pot for creative minds to explore their talents.

name: Dave Jackman
text: Really neat to walk around and see artists doing their thing. Concerts on the docks are usually fun. Avoid the bronze working shop by the dock unless you're looking for bronze statues of naked women, which is pretty much all he does.

resp.text: Hi Dave! Thanks for stopping by. Everett is an extremely talented bronze artist who has worked in the field for years. The work that goes into the process is absolutely unreal. It takes months, sometimes and entire year, to finish one piece. He creates various works, some of which are in fact human figures. Did you know that he designed and cast the bronze trains for the City of Madison as well as the bronze ducks for the Lucky Duck Scavenger Hunt for the City of Huntsville? He is a very talented, hard-working artist, so please be a little bit more considerate.

name: Amy Strickland
text: I am from Decatur, live in N. GA, and my family still lives here, (Madison, AL). We are usually knee deep in family activities, but today my dad took me to The Mill. As an artist and a collector, I am BLOWN AWAY. I consider this a National Treasure, and I have only experienced 1/10th of it. Sensory overload- to have a local man make the arts in his community not only a priority, but a reality for so many artists humbled me as an artist, a patron, and a native of Alabama. Georgia should be so lucky.

name: Jeremy Conry
text: Absolutely wonderful place to visit. Lots of local artists, delicious food, and unique things to buy. Vertical House Records has lots of new, used, and hard to find vinyl along with dvds. Suzy Pops has the best popsicles. Pizzelle’s Confections has wide variety of handcrafted artisan truffles, drinking chocolate, coffees, desserts, and custom cakes to satisfy any sweet tooth. Piper and Leaf has outstanding hot or cold teas in a ton of flavors. Happy Tummy serves up delicious sandwiches. Chef Will offers wonderful vegan and vegetarian dishes from his food truck that sits in front of Lowe Mill. Flying Monkey theatre has an amazing variety of shows.

name: Jam Man
text: It was way more interesting than I thought it would be. Definitely worth a try! Bring some money.

name: Geoffrey Babb
text: Lots of different arts and media being worked in a beautiful open industrial space. It feels home-y and personal in the spaces, but feels connected and (pardon the buzzword) synergistic when taken as a whole. The culinary arts here are fun and don't take themselves too seriously (except for the distillery--that's serious adult business), including a sandwich shop, a chocolaterie, a vegan/vegetarian food truck, a coffee shop, and a popsicle shop. There are performance and event spaces with concerts, dances, and events going on all the time, and the whole of the Mill always feels like something is about to happen. Shops, creators, performers, and businesses contribute to a unique and fascinating atmosphere.

resp.text: Wow! Thank you for the kind words, Geoffrey! We're so glad you love the Mill just as much as we do. See you soon!

name: Katheryn Young
text: I enjoy Lowe Mill on an almost weekly basis: between the Concerts on the Dock in the summer, the theatre and dance events, the three floors of shops and artists' studios, and Piper & Leaf (my real favorite), Lowe Mill has a lot to offer residents and visitors of Huntsville. It is a family-friendly arts facility, with art instalments on every floor and classes for both kids and adults multiple times a month. There is a popsicle shop on the top floor, right next to a bourbon distillery; a record store outside, beside a chocolate and confections shop; a sandwhich stop right inside the front entrance, and multiple hidden jems of the HSV community.
