name: Paul Young
text: One of the best Nature Preserves that I have experienced. This place hosts something for everyone of all ages. Just minutes south of Huntsville. Must see!

name: Timothy Wyant
text: Clean and friendly park. So glad it's open again. Bring the family for a swing and fishing. Kid friendly with a great playground.

name: Chris Karr
text: My family and I have lived in the area for about 2 years now. This park is within minutes of our house. Great place to run, bike, picnic or my personal favorite, to fish. We have three boys, 9, 4, and a 7 month old. The two older ones love the playground here and we often bring our bicycles. Fiahing is great! I fish baitcasters and fly fish. I mostly fish for bass but there are other fresh water species. Overall, this a great place that fits our outdoor needs.

name: Martin Bachtel
text: It’s ok but not nearly as cool as the Moss Rock Preserve in Hoover.  This one needs better maintaining.  On the playground, quite a few of the benches are infested with carpenter bees.  One of the see-saws has a broken handle.  Lots of litter and trash on the playground.  The coolest thing on the playground, the giant swing, is now gone.

name: John Mark “Mark” Hester
text: Great place right off the highway. Creative offerings for kids. Not your typical playground!

name: Samantha Rice
text: What a fun free spot right off the main road in Owens Cross Roads! Our son loves the park and the walk around the pond! The pond walk has plaques with animals facts and a book to read as you walk. He enjoyed running sign to sign!

name: Brandy Wilkerson
text: Their Earth day event was great! Many vendors and local organizations there to show what was going on in the community with regard to environmental and social issues. Very interactive tables. Beautiful area for kids to play. Great trails and able to fish.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad you came to Earth Day!  We are already planning next year's festival! It's going to be amazing!

name: Raymond Theriault (Raym)
text: The lady watching over the grounds was very helpful and knowledgeable.  Visiting was a joy.     :)

name: Sushi52KCCO
text: Great place to take your kids, to get out in nature and just enjoy yourself. So calming

name: Gerald Russell
text: Great Nature Preserve with a playground, fishing, and hiking by the river.  Shaded for summer!

name: Cathy Sumner
text: This is a great place for family photos and the playground is awesome! Lots of stuff to see and areas explore

name: iamb4njos
text: Wonderful little reprieve from the world. Loved watching the turtles.

name: Tracy Werner
text: It was hard to keep track of my grandsons since the playground is so spread out. One of my grandsons tripped over a tree stump that was hidden under leaves and scraped his shin pretty good. It is definitely a nature playground.

name: Carmen Hunter
text: My family loves going to Hayes! Play at the playground, go for a nice walk, ride your bike, fish in the "lake". There's a whole afternoon's worth of fun or relaxation to have!

name: Gloria Berger
text: This place was so beautiful and my children absolutely loved the playground.  We did just the short trail around the pond, but it was still nice and super easy for the kids. We will need to come back to do the other trails and we can't wait. We went around 2 pm and it wasn't too busy. The playground had plenty of shade making it a perfect playing spot.

name: liz stead
text: I love this little hidden gem. It was our first time we went to take photos and play. It has great photo ops and clean bathrooms.

name: Mary Baldwin
text: Such a nice peaceful place to enjoy nature..

name: Geoff Suiter
text: Really nice trail, Huntsville did a good job with the Greenway!

name: Laura Melinda
text: We love Hays! They have great spots to get in and get out of the river for swimming and kayaking. They have a super incredible nature theme park for kids that is very unique and fun for mom and dad too, try their giant swing! They have a cute little pond that’s great for fishing as well and lots of trails and fields. The trail around the pond has interactive things for kids, like a story book that has a page posted every few feet, or animal trivia. It’s such a great place!

name: Claire Tomlin
text: Open and educational! The fresh air and wildlife were amazing!

name: Jim Bo
text: Great place to spend some time outdoors

name: Rob Keating
text: Favorite place for the kids. Feelings have changed since the big swing is gone

name: Gary Holt
text: Lots of walking trails, one piece of advice, take a picture of the map that is posted since there are not any to take with you, plan on an hour or even two to complete the longest trails. Bring a sandwich and a drink and a trash bag for waste.

name: David Keel
text: Beautiful place. Great fishing. I usually drive here from Athens. Definitely worth the drive. :-)

name: Tiffany Sefa
text: Great park loved the educational aspects as well.

name: Ernie D
text: Nice Place To Take The Kids.

name: Emma Troupe
text: Love it...so quiet and peaceful...great scenery...read a book, fish, or take a walk...

name: Christopher Crankshaw
text: Accidentally stumbled onto this place. Very rustic but cool. The giant swing was a hit with the kids. The place was clean. Parking was sparse.

name: Callie Slack
text: Nice park! Lots of pokestops

name: Brian Hood
text: Great place to take the family for a nice stroll through the woods. Easy trails and a nice playground make this fun for kids as well!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often! We will be adding new programs and features during the upcoming year!

name: Jessie Zucnick
text: This is a great place to spend the day.   Clean bathrooms, great trails, great playground!

name: Redz Tablet
text: Beautiful place to be on a beautiful day!

name: Matthew Powell
text: Nice paved trail that goes towards the golf course and publix

name: Tara Donofrio
text: It was possibly the best park I've taken the kids to, quiet and lots of new things for them to do

text:
Wear. Bug. Repellant.

Tyrannosaurus RexMosquitoes... 🦟

Beautiful area w uinique playground at the entrance

name: donna collier
text: It was a wonderful walk for me and my dog we had a great time I was suggested to anybody and everybody

name: Jill Turner
text: Had a great time on the playground with my nephew.  He especially loved the climbing pieces and the music area.  A beautiful day to walk around the pond.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! We are so glad your nephew enjoyed the playground. Hope you visit often.

name: Gretchen Gipson
text: Beautiful, natural, trees everywhere, spaced ou,t natural play equipment. This place sparks the imagination.

name: Victoria Word
text: We had our engagement photos taken here in November 2016, and it was wonderful. The preserve is absolutely stunning in the fall, and seems to have a little bit of something for everyone. Definitely a great place to take a family day trip to, or go solo to bike/hike the trails.

name: Brittney Mcillwain
text: The kid's really enjoyed our walk on a trial!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! So glad they enjoyed walking on a trail. Hope you will check out all the activities, programs and festivals we have year round!

name: Denis Osipychev
text: Nice calm place. Perfect for walking, cycling, bird and nature watching.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  So glad you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve!

name: Jeff Bohler
text: Nice little park with many activities for young children.

name: Gary B
text: Very pretty and peaceful place

name: Andy Johnson
text: Beautiful outdoors game life

name: teresa vann
text: Nice place to walk in nature

name: Jacob Buck
text: This destination has alot to do and fun for all ages! Very much a worth while visit!

name: Djae
text: Nice park to take your family for a day out. Lots of trails and the fishing is pretty good.

name: Darryl Gutierrez
text: This park is a hidden gem ! My kids aged 2 and 5 loved every minute. The playground is situated next to a small fishing pond. A family of geese was swimming in the pond when we pulled up. The playground was so unique and well thought out! It was mostly made of rustic wood and was an imaginative kids dream. There was a fort, a play house, a huge swing, a tunnel, rope bridge, seesaws, sandboxes, a music area, and tons of other equipment. My kids also loved the animals that were carved out of wood and scattered around the park. There are lots of great photo ops as well!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad you enjoyed the many features! We have a few more to add and cannot wait for everyone to see and enjoy them!

name: oldworldTECH
text: Beautiful land on the river. We had some amazing photos done for my daughters 1st birthday. Will definitely be back when the weather is warmer.

name: Kristi Jones
text: Very nice and clean easy for a handicap person to access it

name: Bryan Campbell
text: Nice park with fun, easy trails.

name: Aaron Pendergrass
text: I love our parks! Well maintained walking and biking path. That follows along the river. I always feel so far separated from the hustle and bustle of life when I make a little time for Hayes.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  So glad you enjoy your time and Hays Nature Preserve and hope you visit often.

name: Rustam Radjabi
text: Cool place

name: Debra Carter
text: Awesome place to go with your family we make plans to go every year for the Earth Day festivities and are very impressed with the wonderful facilities in this beautiful area. Thank you to the Hays family for allowing it to be used for so many wonderful events and we plan on visiting much more this year to have some family picnics and hiking or fishing. There are lots of different things for all ages.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  We are so glad that you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve! We have a lot planned for Earth Day this year too!  See you on April 20th!

name: Mike Hammer
text: One of our favorite place in Huntsville

name: Scott Whitt
text: Great place to go hiking

name: NeetarNeet
text: This is a very nice preserve. Great wood made playground with swings for all ages and all sorts of equipment for children. Great hiking, but most of all bring your bike. This Greenway connects to two others... You can bike for a long time with no worries about cars.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review and the comments! Hope you visit again soon.

name: Clay Weisenberger
text: This place has a quirky-cool playground, fishing pond, open fields, and multiple trails.  Great place for a family day the kids.

name: Gina Wakefield
text: Every chance we get! It's a great place and you keep it so clean even the restrooms!  Thank you for a great place to take the grands!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating!  Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Brandon Buckman
text: Super sweet little place

name: Tammy Anthony
text: All I can say is that it's Gods country. Attended my grandson Bryce's birthday party. We had an adventurous day. They have a large Park the kiddos love. Fishing, both walking and hiking trails.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 4-star review! So glad you enjoyed visiting, and that your family celebrated a special occasion here! Hope you visit again soon ---- maybe we can earn that 5th star.

name: J C
text: Average nature preserve. Mostly paved, could benefit from some unpaved trails. Has a playground for kids... not sure wha th issues on the playground.

resp.text: Thanks for visiting Hays Nature Preserve.  There is so much to see within the 538 acres with more than 10 miles of paved and unpaved trails. Hope you will visit again soon.

name: Risa Mendelson
text: We ride our bikes through the preserve and we enjoy looking at the scenery.  It is a well maintained bike trail.

resp.text: Thanks for the five-star review. Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Talisa Robinson
text: We love visiting this lovely place! The summer kids program, Play days at Hays is our favorite! The playground is amazing and we have also enjoyed exploring around the Nature Preserve. It's Mother Nature at it's finest!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Darrell Webb
text: I love chicken my children to this park never a shortage of things to do there fish hiker play

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! Watch for the new features we have planned for 2020. Hope you visit often.

name: Ann Watkins
text: Enjoyed the visit but they close the gates to earlier. Some people needed help and couldn't get in to help them. They needed a trailer to load there boat on. 8:00pm would be a better time to close gate's in the summer months.

resp.text: Thanks for your review and comments. So glad you enjoyed the visit. At this time the Preserve is open 6am to 7:30pm.  Our hours are normally adjusted June 1 for the gates to close at 8pm to extend everyone's summertime enjoyment time.

name: Stephen Bell
text: Nice area, needs maps of trails but nice playground area for children

name: Tatum Roberts
text: One of the best local places for kids. Our family could spend the whole day there. Best of all, it's free!  They have picnic tables, a huge wood playground, and fishing. If you need some alone time, there are plenty of running and hiking trails. During the week it's pretty deserted. Except the occasional field trip day. On the

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review and the compliment! A great team has put lots of planning and work into the Preserve over the past 8 years. We are adding more programs this Fall and next year! Hope you will come and check them out.

name: Ben Eubanks
text: Great fun for the kids, outdoor activities. Best swing I've ever seen!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great review! We have some new features planned for 2020 too! The big swing --- yes, best in the state for sure!

name: Blanca Booker
text: Great place for family to visit, also the offer special activities for our special need individuals.

name: Addie Sanderson
text: Beautiful place to walk and just enjoy nature. Their earth day event is to die for!

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and for the compliment on Earth Day! Hope you make plans to be at this year's festival on Saturday, April 18! We are planning the biggest festival yet with so many new activities.

name: Ben Smallwood
text: Great place for the kids to play in the natural material playground. Has spots available for fishing and great walking/activity trails.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Alabama Reloader
text: We always enjoy hanging out over at Hays...my daughter loves to run around and play at this unique place. Highly recommend it.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating! Hope you are able to visit Hays Nature Preserve often and participate in some of our events for children, with their favorite available adult.

name: Misty Whicker
text: Nice to walk the trails and fish swing and watch my son play on the woden playground and don't forget the huge rope swing

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great rating!  Glad you and your son enjoy the playground! Check out some of the programs we have for children, with their favorite available adult!

name: VICKIE JOHNSON
text: Great area for children to play and use their imagination as well as just go for a walk. Love the big swing.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating! Hope you are able to visit Hays Nature Preserve often!  So glad you love the big swing. We have proclaimed it the best swing in Alabama!

name: Ellen Helton
text: Our family loves Hays! The setting is perfect for a picnic and there is a good variety of trails. Our children especially love the playground which is very unique and has many different play options. We love that it is shady and had bathrooms.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  It is humbling that so many enjoy the playground.  It was the first of its type in the state and one of the largest Arbor Day Foundation certified playgrounds in the nation. We've put a lot of planning and sweat into its design and upkeep over the last 9 years.  Hope you will come to some of our Play Days at Hays programs this summer.

name: No one Important
text: I love this place and so do my kids I love that it doesn't have just a bunch of plastic toys to climb all over. everything is is built by hand and made of wood great place do you have small birthday parties and it's a great place to have photos taken... Engagement graduation maternity just cute pictures if you haven't been go

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  So glad you enjoy visiting Hays. Check out our Play Days at Hays June schedule. Lots of fun for children with their favorite available adult!

name: Summer Crook
text:
It is absolutely beautiful there. The only issue I have is that it closes at 5pm, which in the summer is extremely early.
**Update. They do in fact close later during the summer. 😊

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 4-star review. Our summer hours are 6am-7:30pm, so there is more time to enjoy since days are longer. Hope you will visit again soon - maybe we will earn that 5th star.

name: Bai Bai
text: So beautiful we love the outdoors and kids had a blast playing here! The playground is amazing!

resp.text: Thanks for the great rating! Glad to hear that the kids had so much fun! We have a few new surprises for the playground and some added features in other areas that all will love. Hope you visit often!

name: Karyn Spicer
text: Went for a 3yr olds birthday party.  It was a great area for the kids to run around and play. Just the right size where you could see them playing all over.  Nice shaded area all around, trash cans and bathroom facility. We will be back to explore more!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! The playground was designed with visibility in mind so children can feel like they are roaming in the woods while you are able to watch them. So glad that you enjoyed being here and hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Chris Plott
text: Beautiful place to just sit and enjoy the lake or let you kids play on the playground. Also a great place to get family picture made.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! Hope you visit again soon.

name: Jim Eastman
text: Awesome place to take the family.  Hardwood hand crafted playground equipment,  fishing pond, hiking trails  and picnic area.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Nick Vivian
text: Love this preserve...ride bike and jog through here all the time. They have a great play ground for the younger kids!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit again soon!

name: Rebecca Rideout
text: miles and miles of trails for walking, biking....enjoy the Flint River. some benches and picnic tables available. maintained nicely.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Summer Hipp
text: Unique and beautiful place. Great for the kids and the parents.

name: Ivan Leon
text: Great long trails near HSV

name: Alexis Dobbs
text: BEAUTIFUL JUST GORGEOUS !!!!! SUPER RELAXING. GREAT KIDS PLAYGROUND. NATURE TRAILS HORSE TRAILS AND FISHING. SWIMMING TOO!!!!!  I go here at least twice a week just to soak up the pureness of nature. No i am not being paid to say this either. I just love this place. Ran into a rat snake onve picked it up and put it into. The forest away from where i was fishing.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! We are so glad that you love Hays. A great team has put a lot of planning and sweat into the Preserve's design and upkeep over the last 9 years. Hope you will come to some of our Play Days at Hays programs this summer and watch for our Fall Saturday Series as well as Yoga by the River.

name: Austin Kintzler
text: Wonderful and beautiful. Features a lake, plenty of trails, and a play yard in a perfectly shaded and themed clearing.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star rating! Hope you are able to visit Hays Nature Preserve often!

name: Ashley Tate
text: This is a fun place to take you're kids and go fishing

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! So glad you enjoy visiting and fishing here. Hope you visit often.

name: Sierra Southard
text: My niece loved it. She was smiling the whole time

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad she enjoyed it! Check out our Play Days at Hays schedule! Lots of fun for children with their favorite available adult.

name: Gean Johnson
text: Nice place. We were there with a family group consisting of kids from 2 to 12 years old. We started with a picnic at the pavilion in the playground area. The kids enjoyed that area a good bit. Then we rode bikes to the greenway trail with the bridge and then rode the greenway for a bit. Greenway was very well maintained and very scenic.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review!  Glad you enjoyed several of the areas of Hays Nature Preserve. Hope you visit often!

name: Ads Crane
text: This is one of the best greenways we have been on to date, as far as scenery. There was a gorgeous deep river and a couple of big bridges to cross. I thought it was a little short, as far as greenways go, but we did not know it crossed over the road and connected to another greenway, so we are looking forward to that the next time. Great place to spend an hour or so, and I would love to see the other parts of it.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve again soon and explore more of the 538 acres.

name: Christopher Foeller
text: Well maintained and has a very good diversity of low land trees, perfect for your budding dendrologist

resp.text: Thanks for the great rating! Hope you visit Hays Nature Preserve often.

name: Victoria Holdean
text: Kids love the playground area up front, and the paved path that crosses the river is nice. Haven't been in a while, but you need to plan accordingly if there has been a lot of rain as the path across the river floods over. If the river is really high, I'd keep to the main park side of the river.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 5-star review! So glad the kids love the playground! It was the first of its type to be certified in Alabama and is one of the largest in the nation. There are many trails in the 538-acre Preserve. Good advice - when there has been a good bit of rain the trails near the front in the higher areas are the best bet for exploring. Hope you will visit again soon. Watch for the new programs and features on the playground we will add in 2019 - one is a story time/book and exploring club for kids.

name: linda jones
text: What a great experience this morning. So fun to watch the kids play. Whoever built this should be really proud of themselves because they certainly have created something nice for all of us to enjoy!! Thank you Hays family.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy visiting Hays Nature Preserve! We are adding a few new features and many new free programs this year!

name: Leslie Lo
text: Love this place!! The play area is creative and well spread out. They've recently added bathrooms which is awesome! And lots of nature trails and paved walking options.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoyed your visit to Hays Nature Preserve!

name: Nicole
text: We had a wonderful time exploring the kids area and planning future visits with our children. Beautiful, creative, unique area.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review!  Hope you visit again and check out some of our programs for children and families.

name: Mike n Micki
text: Love coming here w my husband n kids! Kids love the Indian themed playground n Ft Hayes.  A lot of nature things n educational stuff for the family.

name: Michael Trott
text: Nice swamp, many birds, all very natural state. Nice playground for kids. Will come back. (Visited on July 2014 -- sometimes Google Maps says it's closed, but it's open.)

name: John “Mr.Herber OC” Herber
text: Great place to bike and run.  Looks like a great place for kids and is also pet friendly.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! Glad you enjoy biking and running here! You are right it is a great place for kids and for pets. Hope you visit often.

name: Sandy Archer
text: Wonderful creative playground for kids of all ages!

resp.text: Thanks for the 5-star review! So glad you enjoy the playground, which was the first of its type in Alabama. We are glad that so many people appreciate it and make fun memories there.

name: jynni Thor
text:
Beautiful place to run! Wish there were some restrooms however!

Edit 2019: Nice air conditioned restrooms are now located at the park's child play area, but a Port-a-Potty remains the only option if you are back where the paved trails are (and there is only one).

resp.text: Thanks so much for the 4-star review!  We were so excited to have the portable restrooms removed from the front part of the Preserve when the permanent restrooms were constructed.  Maybe one day more can be added.

name: Debora Pederse
text: Charming wooded play area! Perfect for children of all ages!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review! The playground was the first of its type in Alabama to be certified. We will be adding more features this year.

name: Ryan Anderson

name: Tanya Warsheski
text: OMG! We had the best time doing the Pirate Treasure escape room! We were a group of 7 and all of us worked together to solve the riddles that were so creative - better than Dr. Seuss! The decor was so cool and the use of old nautical stuff added to the experience. Some of the puzzles were ingenious and you couldn’t solve it until you found the clue that gave you hints as to how to solve it. Super fun and a challenge. Loved it and highly recommend this escape room.

resp.text: Wow, thanks for all the kind words!  So glad you enjoyed yourselves and I look forward to seeing you next time around!

name: LaTisha Byrd
text: We've been to several local escape rooms and this one by far was the best we've done. It was challenging yet fun and it moved very well. There's a lot of puzzles and locks so it keeps you going and thinking the whole time. We will be back again for sure! Rita is an awesome host!

name: Horton III
text: I took my daughter here for her 11th birthday. She had a wonderful time looking for the treasure. We’ll definitely come back!

resp.text: Thanks so much Leonard! You have a beautiful family and I was so glad to be a part of your first escape experience. Please do come back next time you visit your mama!

name: Christopher Sparks
text:
I've played over 90 escape rooms across North America, and this was certainly my favorite game in the Mobile region! The puzzles were unique, fun, and actually challenging - my partner and I raced against the clock until the very end and won just in time (which was refreshing - we usually steamroll rooms in 40 minutes or less)!

Rita, the owner, was absolutely fantastic and made the experience pure magic! It's clear she pours her heart and soul into creating original puzzles and a unique experience. If you're looking for a great entertainment value in Fairhope, look no further!

name: Jeremy Walley
text: This was such a fun way to spend a lil time with some friends. The pirate room was challenging but not overly difficult , Ms Rita was an awesome host and provided clues when we became stumped with a clue.  We had a blast and will definitely do it again next time we are in fairhope!!!!

resp.text: It was a ton of fun to listen to y'all laugh at yourselves!  Hope to see you again soon!

name: Abby Bartholomew
text: We had so much fun doing this escape! Love the variety of puzzles and the fun immersive detail.

resp.text: Thanks for the review, Abby! Happy New Year!

name: Jamie Shobe
text: We did the pirate room as a business event and had a blast! Rita is great.

resp.text: Thank you, Jamie! Would love for y’all to come back and do the Fairhope room. Merry Christmas to all of you at Sexton!

name: Keri Sims
text: Went with my friends and had a great time! The puzzles were challenging but not impossible. There where a few surprises I had never seen before (and I've been to a few escape room places). I think I actually laughed/squealed in delight after 2 discoveries. We did get magnificently stuck once or twice (don't move/rearrange anything at first!), but the proprietor lady is super helpful giving hints to keep on course. She knocks on the wall, so don't have a heart attack!

resp.text: Thanks for all the kind words, Keri!  So glad you had a great time.  Please come back soon!

name: heath Arndt
text: Great place to go

resp.text: Thanks so much! Enjoyed having your family!

name: Connor Bell
text:
A group of friends and I were staying near Fairhope. We were looking into escape rooms in Mobile and Gulf Shores, but were surprised when this one popped up on our search!

Driving up to the building, we could tell this was a smaller business than other escape rooms we were used to. However, that in no way detracted from its quality! Rita was a wonderful host, and the escape room itself was fantastic. I would highly recommend it to anyone in the area!

resp.text: I just loved your group!  You played so well as a team and I got a big kick out of your thing for blueberries! Come back any time!

name: Kathryn Steele
text: This experience was so much fun! The pirate room was such a swashbuckling-ly good time!

resp.text: Kathryn, your group was a ton of fun! Please tell all of them I loved watching those brain cells firing on all pistons!

name: Lily Anderson
text: BEST ESCAPE ROOM IVE EVER BEEN TO!! So creative and well planned out. GO!!

resp.text: What a sweetheart you are! Thanks so much and have a great time at Jax State!

name: Kerry Thomas Jr
text: My wife and I had an excellent time! Our first escape room and it was a ton of fun! Challenging as well.

resp.text: Thank you so much, Kerry! Hope to see you two again!

name: Bobbi Reed
text: It was soooooo much fun!! I loved all the puzzles, and Rita (the owner) was wonderful. If you're in the area, or even close, I highly recommend this experience.

resp.text: I’m so glad you two enjoyed your adventure! As Shelli said - “Do you know how smart she is?” I loved that! Come back if you are ever in the area, and thanks for the kind words!

name: Briggs Lambert
text:
This was so awesome! Rita is just the best and I promise you will not be disappointed by this experience! Every detail is thought out! Me, my husband and other family members went and had a fantastic time!
It was challenging and exciting the ENTIRE time!
Wish I could give more stars!

resp.text: Your family was just a ton of fun! Great experience for me, too! Hope you have a wonderful dinner together and there are no flags involved!

name: Roxzy Mabry
text: Went with my husband on our six year anniversary and had a wonderful time! We even got to try an additional scape room option about fairhope and it was lovely! Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Roxzy! Happy Anniversary! Please come back soon!

name: J Little
text: My family had a wonderful time at Fairhope Escape Rooms!  We travel extensively and have been to escape rooms of all types, but Fairhope Escape Rooms was one of our absolute favorites!  The pirate themed room was clearly constructed by someone who not only loves escape rooms, but wants to ensure that your group works together and has a positive, fun experience. There were tons of unique &  clever puzzles to solve.  Loads of locks, surprises, and unexpected twists than I have seen in any other escape room before.  Highly recommend!

resp.text: Many thanks for these kind words.  Knowing your family enjoyed themselves makes us very happy!  Enjoyed meeting all of you and hope to see you again.

name: Brian Godsil
text: Fairhope Escape Rooms is definitely one of my favorite rooms! Rita the owner was awesome! The puzzles were very fun and I loved all the unique locks that I haven’t ever seen before. Thank you Rita for the amazing experience.

resp.text: So glad you had a good time, because that’s what it’s all about! Thanks for your kind words!

name: pastor Bennie Richardson, II
text: Great Service and Food.

name: Jessica Donahue
text: We loved this escape room! Rita, the owner, is very passionate about this business and has put a lot of thought and research into the planning. I highly recommend getting a group together and visiting!

resp.text: Thank you, Jessica! I hope you and Heath have a wonderful 2019!

name: Anthony Phillips
text: We had an amazing time! Absolutely stellar fun! Rita was a wonderful hostess and person. Seven first time escape room attendees all left ready to schedule our next soiree. It was nonstop and far more challenging than I had expected. Thanks so much for the experience.

name: Dominique Garcia
text: Great time! Super fun and interesting!

resp.text: Thanks, Dominique, and congratulations on your graduation! Good luck at South!

name: Rachel
text: Challenging but rewarding! Overall great experience!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Rachel! Enjoy the rest of your break!

name: LeeAnne Ryan
text: Great time! Rita is a great host. It was a lot of fun for three teens and parents.

name: Amy Bowden
text: What an incredible fun time! If you have not been yet then what are you waiting for? I am new to the area and amazed that very few people have heard of this fun place :) Rita spent a lot of extra time with us explaining how she got started and clearly puts her heart and soul into entertaining us locals and visitors alike!

name: Mary Sellhorn
text: Family friendly and helpful clues.  Treasure hunt format rather than escape. First of 3 planned rooms.  Had a ball, matey!

resp.text: Many thanks, Mary!  Please come back again!

name: Candise Carter
text: The best breakout room I've ever done. I've done probably 15 breakout rooms all across the gulf coast this one takes the cake! Rita is amazing at  explaining everything and you can tell she has a passion for this it's not just another mass produced, chain trying to make another dollar. I suggest everyone get some friends together and get over there!

resp.text: Thank you, Candise! I do really enjoy meeting people and watching them have a good time together in a thought-provoking way. So glad you enjoyed it!

name: Stephany Hannon
text: We did the Pirate Ship escape room and had a wonderful hour together! Our family of seven adults laughed & rushed through the clues to finally discover the hidden treasure with only 2 seconds left on the clock! We will do this again!! A lot of fun for adults looking for something to do together.

name: Dale Sandford
text: Great time for group of 3.  Challenge is not easy..

resp.text: You guys were great! Please come visit again if you’re ever in the area!

name: Daniel Roebuck
text: Rita does an outstanding job with her escape room that she created!  The pirate themed puzzle adventure was the highlight of our weekend and we ended up being the 2nd place team in the existence of her room!

resp.text: So glad it was fun for you!  I got a kick out of watching your group work together!

name: Brooke Howe
text: This was my 4th escape room experience, but was by far my favorite. It was so detailed, and there were fun puzzles and surprises at every turn. I would highly recommend it!

name: Julia Buss
text: This was my third Escape Room, and I would have to say it was the best experience I've had. Friendly staff, great puzzles and a fun time was had by all!!

name: John Carter
text: This is by far the best escape room I've completed. My wife and I have completed 10 eacape rooms so far from Gulfport to fairhope and this is the most detailed. Rita was amazing, room design was amazing, and twist and turns were abundant. If and when they setup their next room I will be first on that list. Thanks for the great experience.

resp.text: Thank you! I’ll send you a notification if I change the theme or finish a new one. Look forward to laughing with y’all again!

name: K Claude
text: This place is awesome. I can't recommend it more. Ms. Rita is the sweetest woman ever.

name: Charles Michal
text: Rich in clues, great props, good mental challenges!!

name: Lorie Beekman
text:
If I could give 10 stars that still wouldn't be enough.  I took my 13 year old niece and my autistic, visually impared son and rita could not have been more accommodating.  The attention to every little detail, the sights, the sounds, etc.  My niece said she felt like she was on a pirate ship.  We had a blast and definitely will be back.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND Fairhope escape rooms.  Thank you rita for an amazing time we won't ever forget.  Be seeing you again very soon.
Lorie Beekman
Daphne, AL

name: Lord Alexander Howell
text: Great puzzles and they are really nice.

name: Mari C. Alexander
text: The Freedom Walk teaches/shows you so much about the history of the terrible things that happened in Birmingham and the fight to change the atrocities. I enjoyed the audio tour that we could call in and get further details on each stop. The reason for 4/5 is because of all the men (homeless or otherwise) that hang out there and congregate at one portion of the park or come up and try to give you an unsolicited tour (made it a little uncomfortable to view everything, and at our own pace), there doesn't seem to be any care given to the Reflection Pool and there's no water in it, and lastly because of the graffiti on the Pavilion.

name: Shir Carson
text: Educational, reflectional, and peaceful. Beautiful lawns and right across the street from the Civil Rights Institute, and 16th Street Baptist Church! Beautiful place to bring your children and or for peace of mind.

name: Dan Bird
text: Amazing and sad story of civil rights movement. I visited this place 4 days before Martin Luther King day with my coworker who wanted to explore his heritage.  I was a very appalled by the situations the marchers had to endure by local authorities.  If you wanna check out the real story check out the museum across the street from the church.

name: MrJcaston
text: What a powerful experience.  I love history and this is a site to see. I was truly moved and inspired to do better and ensure the freedom of the generations to come. The park is well kept and simply beautiful.

name: Sara Beth Wade
text:
This is a great experience! Especially as an add-on to the Civil Rights Museum. The museum isn't currently open, so I'm visiting what I can and the sculpture is well done and powerful in its own right.

I did get a little hustled though by a homeless man - he told me "those signs won't tell you anything, let me tell you everything" and launched into a barely understandable spiel that lasted for a few minutes. I didn't mind (and didn't feel threatened) but unless you want to part with some cash, you might want to tell him you don't have any up front.

name: Momof 3Kds
text:
We enjoyed all of the statues in this park. We could do the Civil Rights tour and the 16th street Baptist church was not opened due to covid. So this was a bit of a substitute.

There was a person blowing leaves and trash there "cleaning" so we had to scurry a bit because it was blowing on us. There were some people whom may have been homeless hanging out in the park so just br a little cautious and watchful there.

I would love to go back when everything is opened for a full tour.

name: Tiwanna Sanders
text: Love that it's close to the Civil Rights Museum. Also you can help the homeless there too.

name: VBrou X
text: Beautiful Historic Location, Everyone should Visit, Just WOW!! What Took place here in the early 60s is shocking..

name: Jason Shafer
text: Quick frienfly. Great good

name: David King
text: Well kept/clean. Nice informative placards and monuments.

name: Joey Prentiss
text:
Incredible place to learn about the civil rights movement. There is an interactive tour that is accessible by telephone. The stories and the sculptures are humbling. I didn't expect to feel as heavy as I felt. I also met Stanley who is in a wheelchair. Stanley offered to show me around. I found it best to walk in a clockwise direction.  I highly recommend visiting the park as the civil rights was not that long ago and it effects you whether you recognize it or not.

Note: both the civil rights museum and baseball museum are closed on Mondays.

name: Wesley Abbott
text: Great history behind the church. Don't longer to long if your not about being approached by dope boys

name: Wesley Moss
text: A nice enough park. But the homeless in the city berate passerbys. Its sad the city allows these parks to be overrun.

name: Kimberly Lindsey
text: Nice peaceful place to spend the afternoon..... Spread out a blanket read a book and get some sun...

name: Texanna James
text: This park definitely invokes all the feels about the Africa American experience during the struggle for equal treatment. The monuments took my breath away. We had some real conversation about the happenings, we looked up historical data and We left with a greater appreciation of what the fight for civil rights entailed for those sprayed with hoses and attacked by police and dogs.

name: Scott
text: Stopped by while waiting on the Birmingham Museum of Art to open and it was very interesting.

name: K J
text: A lot of birmingham history right here.  The statues are powerful

name: Jen Walker
text: This park instills such inspiration in your soul

name: Wesley Abbott
text: Great history behind the church. Don't longer to long if your not about being approached by dope boys

name: Wesley Moss
text: A nice enough park. But the homeless in the city berate passerbys. Its sad the city allows these parks to be overrun.

name: Lemeika McCarthy
text: BEAUTIFUL!!

name: Terry Green
text: An eye opening experience for me to be able to take a trip back in time to gain a greater understanding as to how things were. It is a beautiful park, with a not so beautiful history.

name: Texanna James
text: This park definitely invokes all the feels about the Africa American experience during the struggle for equal treatment. The monuments took my breath away. We had some real conversation about the happenings, we looked up historical data and We left with a greater appreciation of what the fight for civil rights entailed for those sprayed with hoses and attacked by police and dogs.

name: Scott
text: Stopped by while waiting on the Birmingham Museum of Art to open and it was very interesting.

name: K J
text: A lot of birmingham history right here.  The statues are powerful

name: Vanessa Tate Finney
text: Make sure you call the phone number to do the audio walking tour. The exhibits are really powerful in terms of immersing yourself in the environment of the Birmingham Campaign. It's a shame the fountains were empty and not working. Also be aware that homeless people in Birmingham tend to hang around this area because it's high traffic for tourists.

name: LaTesicia Sanders
text: Had a great time,  we feed the less fortunate

name: Terry Green
text: An eye opening experience for me to be able to take a trip back in time to gain a greater understanding as to how things were. It is a beautiful park, with a not so beautiful history.

name: Jeramy Bowie
text: Very informative, and a very beautiful park.

name: Ethic Grind
text: I good place for some history!

name: Cavinda Caldera
text: The historical significance of the area is well documented with some nice murals.

name: Sierra Washington
text: It was amazing there was a guy out there with so much information that wasn't on the plagues. I was so happy to have this experience with my family.

name: Monica Raybon
text: Nice little place. .. sunshine, fresh air, easy parking, easy on/off. I-65, MLK statue, near the church and civil rights center

name: Janna Harrison
text: Beautiful. I've never seen a neon green butterfly until i visited here. Very important part of American History was captured here in statue and plaques. A lot of homeless people hanging in the park, but weren't a bother. They were very kind with greetings. We did happen to get one gentleman a meal at a Resturaunt called Ms B's a block away. We didn't eat there, so i cant give it a review.

name: Terrie Childress
text: We served the homeless here on a Saturday morning. It's very nice and has alot of history to offer. This park is very clean and a must see if you are in the area.

name: Nate Chertack
text: An amazing park, worth the visit. There are sculptures spread through the park with associated plaques telling the story of 1963 Birmingham. Many of the sculptures are extremely moving, evoking fear, sadness, and anger, but also hope for a better world. I went around sunrise and it was pretty good lighting for great photos. The park was pretty empty around that time.

name: Eric Lawler Sr
text: It was a very nice historical park lots of class details about civil rights.

name: Silas Robertshaw
text: Across the street from the 16th St Baptist church, this place pulses with history, of both hope and the oppression from which that hope sprang.  I was sad the civil rights museum was closed, but the park is uplifting all by itself.

name: Walter Miranda
text: What a beautiful place just bursting with history. The Freedom Walk was incredibly powerful and moving. When my son is old enough to understand, we will visit Birmingham and this park together.

name: Josh L
text: Park with powerful historical significance

name: Jessica MacPhail
text: Thanks to Ricky for sharing his story with me, and Tony for taking the Freedom Walk with me. You made it a special experience.

name: Christopher Gonzales II
text: Great look at history.

name: Bridget Ford
text: Love it . Im loveong Al

name: Zandra Chestang
text: It's a good place to learn History that happened back in the the 1960's especially if you can't make it to the museum.

name: Veronica Jarrett
text: This park was amazing.

name: Jeremy South
text: The most humbling experiences one would ever have the privilege to obtain.

name: Edward Ellsberry
text: I found peace just being there...

name: Lemeika McCarthy
text: BEAUTIFUL!!

name: George Frazier
text: This park is amazing

name: Shalom Bhasker
text: So much historic value. Feels like a place we should all go learn about some history.

name: Michael “Prince” Watson
text: Extremely informative park giving vivid depictions of the hardships of blacks during the segregation of the south. Well kept lawns. Adjacent to 16th Street Baptist Church and The Civil Rights Institute & Museum.

name: Royal Carlisle
text: Great history park!

name: PlainJaneGaming Bee H
text: This park was ground zero for Birmingham's civil rights movement.   There is a fantastic free audio tour taking you from one amazing and powerful sculpture to the next.  This tour was educational  and awakening.   I love this beautiful park.  I'll definitely go back again.  You can feel the history here. Very powerful place.

name: Ken and Alicia Lund
text: Beautiful park with significant markers and civil rights sites in its midst.

name: Michael Dover
text: Eye opening experience!

name: Tim Manning
text: It was great!! Very clean!!

name: Nikki Guthrie
text: The story of Kelly Ingram is one of valor and camaraderie, but it does not relate to the civil rights movement at all. It is time to rename this park!There are many sculptures sprinkled through the park, and these tell the story of the fight for equality. This park needs a tour on its own to be familiar with the works of art that abound. This park is also the beginning of a walking tour called "the freedom trail". I highly suggest this walking tour, one of many offered by the plaques that stand in the downtown area of Birmingham.

name: JoVana Fairley
text: So much History. I urge every one to go during the week. They have too many *unofficial* tour guides on the Weekend.

name: makella moore
text: The place I chose to marry the love of my life with close family and friends surrounding us.

name: John Steed
text: One of the most impressive civil rights monuments I've had the pleasure to visit; especially in the current climate.

name: Corey Cathey
text: Dope heads and want to be doe boys make the pake not worth wile

name: Lynda Jordan
text: Part of Birmingham's civil rights history in a walk through park. It's a great place to teach children about civil rights movement.

name: Adib Rashid
text: Nice park with an historical touch

name: Vero Jarrett
text: Very educational park.

name: Tacoya Savage
text: It's a Historic Place to visit

name: Karen Pritchett
text: Awesome experience. Thank God for Change

name: Blake Allen
text: Beautiful place to remind Birmingham of it's troubled past and how we can be better.

name: Yolanda Crawford
text: Beautiful and well maintained. I loved every minute of being there. It was humbling and touching. A place everyone should visit at least once.

name: Marcus Wright
text: Great park nice vibe everyone should visit when they have a chance

name: Jimmy Sadler
text: Eye opening, moving moments in history.

name: Daminick1980
text: Very moving park. The statues that tell Birminghams civil rights fight are powerful.

name: Gwen Hall
text: Very nice place.

name: Mike Hump
text: Great place to visit and have .

name: Brice Jackson
text: All BHMians should visit! It’s a rich place to teach our families about BHMs complex past, to remember the sacrifice of some many who fought for equal justice & opportunity for everyone in BHM, & prayerfully propel us toward a brighter future!

name: Dewey Pittman Jr
text: I took a minute to walk through the park. I had just left the area a week prior because of jury duty. It hit me how history is right here in Birmingham. Moving throughout this city with my eyes 'wide shut'

name: Omar Ali
text: History History History you must take a walk down memory lane.  You don't know your past you can't know your future. Must see for all that visit Birmingham.  Sad but eventful Knowledge is change.  Bring your cameras and tissue lasting memory.

name: Terminal Frost
text: Very humbling. History isn't always understandable, however it is... history to learn from.

name: Donzell “Sleep” Bowman
text: Learned alot

name: Mike P
text: Loved this place

name: Emmaline Moore
text: Very beautiful and haunting history of the Civil Rights struggle for African Americans. We went at night which really made it a more sombre experience. There are a few homeless who stay there but they are harmless, usually asking for change and one gentleman walked around with us to point out each sculpture's meaning as well as the memorial to the Birmingham bombing victims across the way. Just use common sense and go with others if you visit in the evening.

name: Mia Blowe
text: 😁 EXCELLENT see our Heritage

name: Lindi Pearson
text: Beautiful  And lovely poor but we could not even have a picking than it conversation there. During the almost 15 minutes we were sitting there   Discussing an upcoming Property Decision with a business associate and doctor, We had 8 people Harass us for money, cigarets, food, etc. They didn't just ask once they would argue with us about why we weren't giving them anything and why we should give them something. It would get downright hostile with some of them and 2 of them followed us to our cars. We finally had to leave without finishing our discussion because everyone was so uncomfortable. The police need to really get in there and clean out all those parks so that the public, who actually funds them, can enjoy them.

name: Andrew Henderson
text: A wonderful slice of Birmingham history. A must visit historical civil rights site.

name: Teresa Hill Berry
text: Those were truly hard times for African Americans. The park on represent a small amount of what black people had to go through. Don't think racism has gone away. Racism is still here to stay. Back in the day racism was in the jails and hospitals it still is. We've come a long ways and we still have a long ways to go.

name: Norma Large
text: Beautiful park.  Sure you can find a kind man to be your guide.  Ours was terrific.  Very informative.

name: Courtney Prude
text: It's a great place to visit from a historical standpoint. However, at night it's a magnet for homeless people.

name: Donald Cooper
text:
This park which sits catty-corner to the 16th Street Baptist Church features several pieces of evocative and exquisite statuary which commemorate key moments from the Civil Rights Era.
The natural setting is conducive for quiet contemplation.

name: Albert Fann
text: Enjoyed sharing the History with my Fifteen year old Nephew!!

name: Samuel Guerra
text: It's a really interesting place to learn more about the history of slavery and African Americans, I strongly recommend it.

name: I S
text: Pretty downtown park.

name: David Jones
text: Although the history presented is painful its message is one of hope and love.   Powerful and emotional.

name: Michael Wilson
text: Park was clean & quite to bad the rain forced me to leave so sad?

name: Walter Henderson
text: Disturbing for me!

name: Nick
text: Great place to learn the history of the civil rights movement in Birmingham. Monument statues all over, and at least 3 guided paths you can walk around downtown to follow the different marches that took place during the movements. We followed the Palm Sunday March, which MLKJ had also participated in when he got arrested and then sent the famous letter from Birmingham jail. That took us to city hall and Linn Park, with at least 15 signs guiding the way and sharing inspirational thoughts, photos, and history, as well as ideas for discussion and education for young and old.

name: Charles Lockhart
text: So historical information on Birmingham Civil Rights

name: Sharon Williams
text: Nice, breezy day. Enjoyed the park, and walking fir a cause. Jory's Journey Walk for Autism Awareness. Park was nice and clean

name: Brandon Guise
text: Love the history.

name: R Holifield
text: Great place to go to to walk around and check out the museum on a date Maybe. Very knowledgeable I made that word up LOL

name: Malia Fort
text: A living monument to acknowledge and honor the sacrifices and suffering of those who fought for our Civil Rights. The statues & plaques situated throughout the park tell the story of triumph in a unique & beautiful park.

name: Travis Wells
text: Very glad for the opportunity to take my son to this important location of our history as a nation. The park is well laid out, and the sculptures are hauntingly creative. As other reviewers have said- be prepared to be solicited by panhandlers.

name: Miss Behave
text: Nice historic park to visit. Great place to take kids. Nice walk. Plenty of parking.

name: Brent
text: Nice, clean civil rights themed small Park

name: Anne Hicks
text: The often brutal fight for civil rights is not that far behind us. Look at these statues and the church across the street and remember what has been gained...and lost. I started listening to the audio tour, but ended up talking to a elderly homeless man instead. The people in the park are the most respectful and placid homeless population that I have encountered in many decades of urban living. They were all sitting in what I assume are their spots, and stayed put. Nobody asked me for anything. I was there with my young son and elderly mother and did not feel unsafe. The only annoyance that I encountered was a younger man who came over from across the street and zoomed in on me with some story about a pregnant wife and blatantly asked for money.

name: Rex McDonald
text: Most that we saw were still observing distancing and mask protocol.

name: Matthew “The Joker” Lambertson
text: Good park, just ignore any homeless people who come up to you asking for money and they will leave you alone. The park has many monuments dedicated to those that played a part in the Civil Rights Movement. There is even a monument dedicated to the four girls who died in the sixteenth Street Baptist church bombing. Across the street from the civil rights movement. Kiddy corner from the park is the Sixteenth Street Baptist Church. Only a few blocks from Linn Park.

name: Rickey Wife
text: It's a great and wonderful place to learn about our black history on young teens today need to go and learn about our culture and our past so they can put the guns down and pick up more books for knowledge and education to make this world a better place for colored people

name: Richard Siderko
text:
A very well done step by step recount of  Birmingham Civil rights protests through sculpture, statue and descriptive placards.  Quite moving
Gives one pause for trying to imdert how some could be so cruel to fellow humans because of the color of their skin and I'm particular children of the color of their skin.  The park is very well kept. It needs to be preserved as as reminder of what happened.  One block away is the Citizens Drugstore building. Meter parking on street.

name: Bridget Griggs PhD
text: We visited the RESPECT Rally at the park and it was lovely to participate with that as well as be able to walk through the park to explain African American history to my son through the art available throughout the park.

name: Vincent Kohlheim
text: Every black person should visit

name: hannahcurrie03 _
text: Not much play space, but cool monuments.

name: Vikki Grodner
text: The rich history of this corner in Birmingham should not go unnoticed when visiting the city. At the epicenter of the civil Rights movement, Kelly Ingram Park continues to provide the stage for some of the nation's and the area's most important political and societal conversations.

name: Nathan Keith
text: Great concept with recorded guided tours. Many of the displays are starting to rust and need to be restored. A dry  4 pool fountain in the middle of the park is the biggest sign that repair and restoration is needed. The park was pretty clean for a crumbling park.

name: Shanna Barton
text: Historical in value, great for walking and jogging onnthe many sidewalk paths throughout the park. Parking on 3 side is awesome!

name: Leon Da 1
text: Very touching walking in the steps of civil rights history. Touching . Heart felt. Uplifting.Energizing . Thank God for our ancestors an their struggle sacrifice for the betterment of all people!

name: Sarah Schwab
text: You can read and watch documentaries and try to learn, but there is something much more powerful about walking through history.

name: Donta Jones
text:
Love it!!!!
Please visit this place...
If you would like to learn history about things that happened back in the 60's and back.
Come visit..

name: Kelsey
text: A park with historical significance. Came for Juneteenth but learned more from the statues and markers. Nearby the Birmingham Civil Rights Museum. You should visit both for a fil picture of the movement's history in Birmingham.

name: Jonathan McKinney
text: This display of American history is captivating.

name: King Charles
text: Educational

name: Christopher Birl
text: Five stars as far as the history goes 0 Stars 4 the bombs and homeless that uses this place for a dope hole

name: Bevan Shores
text: Many walk by this park and don’t recognize they are walking on a historical site that changed the south. After touring the Human Rights Museum in Memphis, this brought to light much of what we learned there. The sculptures challenge you as you are able to see yourself in the perspective of those being horribly mistreated by racism. The dogs, the imprisonment, the water canons, the children killed by the church bombing. At the same site, you can see the march routes and follow those. Every 100 meters or so there is a marker with further information on what was going on at two key marches that took place. This isn’t something to be rushed through, allow yourself the time to experience what this place meant for history. Across the street from the park is 16th Street Baptist Church one of many churches bombed. After seeing the history of this site, it challenges you to think what your voice is about today...are there things that I need to be fighting for or speaking on behalf of??

name: Carson Elmore
text: A wonderful park that's at the center of Birmingham culture. Everything from major activism to a family picnic takes place in this park. A great example of the civil Rights history of the area, also, where many of the new civil rights trails converge. A truly Birmingham park.

name: Nikolai Krestinksky
text: First time at this park, came to hear Bernie Sanders geat turnout. Really nice park.

name: Kenneth Kuk
text:
Historic area and a pleasant park in the city.
I came here after listening to Malcolm Gladwell's podcast on the Foot Soldier statue - which is more than worth a listen.

name: H Melville
text: Located in the heart of Birmingham's Civil Rights District, the site of so much history. Wonderfully moving sculptures remind visitors of those times. Visit the Civil Rights Institute & Sixteenth Street Baptist Church, then take a stroll through the park and enjoy a picnic. Soak in the history so that we never forget what came before.

name: Mist One
text: Visited this park on a whim. Made a two hour drive because of an episode of Malcolm Gladwell's Revisionist History podcast. The episode, Foot Soldier, is dedicated to a sculpture in the park. The park provoked a lot of thought and reflection about race in America and the evolving Civil rights movement. I recommend going during the day. I witnessed a man with mental illness become really agitated and aggressive when I was there. The police were able to de-escalate the situation and calm him down quickly, which was impressive - I didn't expect thing to go so smoothly. Hat's off to the officers who responded. That was the only drawback of the visit. We found a hotel without a reservation and enjoyed the night and next day in the city. Listen to the podcast and visit the park with someone you enjoy talking with. It's worth it.

name: John Theabolt
text: Excellent jumping off point to the Civil Rights District!  Very informational, self-guided walking tour.

name: Carlos Houston
text:
Heartwrenching! History created off just doing the right thing...and it hurt children as well!
Adults, on both ends of the color spectrum, still need to do the right thing because it is the right thing to do not because it makes you uncomfortable.
Christian life in this carnal world is not comfortable! Everybody man up! The kids did in 1963 and still do in 2018!

Not only is it in the center of Birmingham's roughest neighborhood but is also crawling with beggars with no security to offset them. One went as far as to ask if I needed to know where to find "any kind of drugs or thugs I could need" directly on park property

text: It has a great concept: to commemorate all hardships balck people had to endure to get equal rights. The monument to child victims of hate crimes is heartbreaking. Unfortunately, it's full of homeless people who will harass you if you are by yourself. Some are quite aggressive and hostile. The monuments are really worth seeing, but come in a daytime and as a group. Otherwise it's scary and unsafe.

name: Darrick Newsome
text: Loved the way it didn't simply show the courage of average people like most museums and parks of this kind do. This park went a bit further.  The designers knew the torrid history of this area and found it fitting to show visitors that it wasnt all peaceful chants.  It was hard. It was scary.  It was powerful.  This is a place to go to ensure we never forget this dark chapter of history so that hopefully we never repeat it.

text:
Lovely park. I was immediately approached by a fella who I believe was homeless. He took me around and really gave me a good tour and told me things that I would not have known otherwise. He did expect to be paid for his services.  That would have been fine....but I was approached by 4 other gentlemen for money while I was trying to get back to my car.

Maybe the city could pay some of those guys to give tours. And discourage others from panhandling in the park.

name: Eve Edstrom
text:
My kids (aged 12 and 9) and I walked through and read each station.
We were all honestly taken up in the moment and very much enjoyed visiting the park

We paused for a long while to read about the four little girls killed in the 1963 bombing at the 16th Street Baptist Church...it was all a great stop to make in culmination of reading "The Watsons Go To Birmingham 1963" by Christopher Paul Curtis.

We did want to visit the Civil Rights' Institute but it was closed on the Monday we happened to be there.

text: Very nice place. Please keep it clean. It was much nicer when no-one knew about it.

name: paul flomer
text: My 10 year old son had a blast exploring

name: Mike S
text: Love it!!!!!  So serene.

name: lindsey stephens
text: Awesome spot!

name: Marc Tucci
text: Walk along the creek and there are big stepping stone rocks. The falls is 8 or 9 feet tall and feeds into a nice pond area where you can swim

name: William White
text: Great place for young kids to swim, clear and cold.   Low rocks they can safely jump from. Gravel beach and a lot of flat boulders for lounging.   About 250m from the old bridge.  Go west on the trail on the north side of bridge.  When the trail splits go left.  When you go around a boulder with a boardwalk going around it you are close watch for a small stack of stones and a 5" tree tilted 45 degrees on the left.   Follow trail down.  You can hear the falls when you get close.

name: Kimberly Glass
text: I love this place, it's so welcoming

name: Jose Delafuente
text: Nice😎👍

name: Al W.
text: it took me a while to find this place but it was worth the years of searching

name: Paul Noblitt
text: Neat place

name: Samuel Holloway
text: This waterfall is beautiful.

name: Robert Chlebos
text: The route of the trails are confusing. You can easily get turned around in the woods.

name: Ben Boyd
text: There are no official pathways or markings to lead you here. You can reach it from the mountain bike trails that are nearby.

name: Chris
text: Really beautiful

text: Awesome veiw

name: Gary Grimes
text: Treasures of history in a wonderful and enjoyable setting.   Fascinating and no stress attraction.   Highly recommended!

name: Veronica Cranford
text: The guide was very knowledgeable and happy to show us all the treasures of history they had to share.

name: Dorothy Brogden
text: Three Notch Museum is so much more than I expected!! So much history of not only the area, but history of the United States as well. I took 2 of my grandsons and they had a blast. The lady who works there is so friendly & knowledgeable!! I highly recommend it!!!!

name: Jared Eastman
text: Very knowledgeable curator, classic southern hospitality, very eager to help and teach.

name: Kathy Crook
text: Great museum. A lot of information. Nice displays on a variety of topics. This is the place to find anything and every thing about Andalusia.

name: J.C. Daughtrey
text: Lots of history, my kid loves the train cars

name: Doom Sucker
text: This place has so much history about Andalusia and the rest of Alabama, I learned so much I didn’t know

name: Lisa Trevino
text: Love this little piece of history
